characters: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH DECK WINDOW
INTO A POOL OF LIGHT BEHIND HER. JASON.
POINT OF VIEW THROUGH GRID WORK
JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW, (SECOND UNIT - N.Y.)
THE TURNSTILE LIKE THE TERMINATOR, TEARING THE ALUMINUM
THROUGH THE DINER DOOR, MOWING A PATH STRAIGHT TOWARDS
A GRUESOME SHADOW ON THE WALL
PONT OF VIEW FROM KITCHEN OVENS
POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)
FIRST WORDS HE HAS EVER SPOKEN COME OUT, IN THE VOICE OF
MIDNIGHT, HUGE BOLTS OF LIGHTNING CRACKING OVER
BREAKS THE SURFACE FOR A BREATH OF AIR, SINKING AGAIN.
POINT OF VIEW OUT REAR WINDOW, (STUNT DRIVE)
AROUND, RAISING THE AXE, BRINGING IT DOWN ON JASON'S
POINT OF VIEW OUT HOUSEBOAT WINDOW
HIMSELF FROM IT, TACKLING THE SANITATION ENGINEER AND
CREEPS IN A SEMI-CIRCLE AS A SILHOUETTED FIGURE STEPS
THE GROUND, KICKING MADLY AS THE LIFE IS BEING CHOKED OUT
DOOR HOOK, HER BODY PIN-CUSHIONED WITH A DOZEN MIRROR
MISS VAN DEUSEN'S POINT OF VIEW
JASON'S HAND GRIPS HIS SHOULDER, SPINS HIM AROUND AND
...A LARGE FIGURE STEPS OUT, HOLDING WHAT APPEARS TO BE A
THE BACK DOOR AS HE SWINGS IT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark, rumbling sky. Haze clings to the lake as we float across it, clearing to bring the opposite shoreline into  view. A few scattered streetlights. Dilapidated cabins.  An abandoned campsite. CAMP CRYSTAL LAKE.  We continue to drift towards it, hearing the faint sound  of seductive music and an occasional giggle. A small  HOUSEBOAT floats into our foreground, its interior light  flickering as TWO BODIES move around inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teenage boy and girl, JIM and SUZY, are slow-dancing.  Jim's lips softly touch her lissome shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...how do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask me in about five minutes. She bites his ear, giggles, then kisses him fully..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about graduation. Being  totally free to do whatever we want  now. Her hands slip inside his Pendleton shirt. He sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It feels excellent. Her mouth finds his again. After a long kiss, he gently  pulls away from her with a teasing smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta throw the anchor over. He leaves the cabin. She slips under the bed sheets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jim tosses a small anchor overboard.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON WATER SURFACE
dialogues.text: as the weighty object splashes, sinking into black  oblivion, pulling its cable down with it.

dialogues.speaker: JIM
dialogues.text: glances at the lake, at their eerie surroundings. He  feels a chill, heading back inside.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (TANK)
dialogues.text: as the anchor drifts to the lake bottom, dropping a few  feet from a THICK POWER CABLE which rests in the lake  silt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jim returns with an uneasy expression. He crawls on  top of the bed, kissing her again, but not with the same  enthusiasm as before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He starts to pull off his shirt and join her. She senses  his anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Jimmy. Something's bothering  you. Jim pauses, turning off the mood music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that we're right around that  old summer camp where all those  murders took place. The boat creaks. She's instantly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What murders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind, you don't want to know  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing to worry about, Suzy.  The guy's dead now, somewhere at the  bottom of this lake...if you believe  the stories. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's drop it, okay? He starts to kiss her again. She stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What stories? He doesn't want to go into it but Suzy's face insists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was this boy named Jason  Voorhees who drowned in Crystal  Lake...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Eight year old JASON is desperately trying to tread  water, flailing his arms like a marionette to get  attention as he gulps down gallons of mossy lake water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp....me....I'm drowning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the counselors heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmmommy.... ...And Jason finally slips under the surface for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of years went by and everybody  forgot about it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when the murders started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as our senses are bombarded with QUICK CUTS of assorted teenagers just about to die, their screams echoing over  each other. We do not see the attacker. As the  cacophony reaches a screeching crescendo, CUT BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the silence hits us hard again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason did it...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what some people thought. But  they were wrong.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK, (STOCK)
dialogues.text: as MRS. VOORHEES comes directly at camera wielding a huge knife and a primal scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother blamed the counselors for  his death and tried to kill them all. (dramatic pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She got her head chopped off by one of  them. We don't need to see this clip...Suzy's reaction is quite sufficient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the murders stopped? He gives her a long, penetrating look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're bombarded with QUICK FLASHES of a hockey masked  JASON wreaking havoc on assorted teenagers...brandishing  everything from hatchets to knives to chainsaws. Just as  Jason is about to stab us, CUT BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy flinches as if she were getting the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Legend has it that Jason came back to  avenge his mother's death, vowing to  kill every teenager from the area.  (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every now and then, the murders  start up again.  The boat lurches slightly, tugging at the anchor cable.  She's scared: he's frightened himself a little, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it, Suzy. They're just  stories. He brushes her hair back, kissing her cheek gently,  finding the nape of her neck again. She closes her eyes,  trying to dismiss what he's dredged up. But she can't.  Suzy begins to rationalize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the last graduating class,  right?  Jim's kissing her body, putting Jason behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, Lakeview High just closed its  doors for good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's no reason for him to come  back because there won't be any of us  around...right? Jim stops, looking her squarely in the eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Except that Jason isn't real  so none of it matters anyway. She starts to relax, returning his kisses.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (TANK)
dialogues.text: as the anchor drifts along the lake floor, tugging hard  on the power cable. Camera TRACKS along the cable,  coming to a RUSTY SET OF CHAINS TANGLED AROUND IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jim slides on top of Suzy. Thoughts of Jason are  starting to slip away along with their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (TANK)
dialogues.text: as the chains emit a dull tinkle due to movement from the tugging anchor. Camera continues to TRACK again...and we  find to our horror that the waterlogged, fish-eaten body  of JASON IS SECURED BY THESE SAME CHAINS. (NOTE: Jason's  face is obscured.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teenagers in love, lost in not-so-innocent passion. At  the same moment:

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (TANK)
dialogues.text: The anchor tugs one last time and RIPS THROUGH THE CABLE. SPARKS INSTANTLY FLY, chasing along the cable, finding  the chain which secures Jason and ENGULFING HIM IN  ELECTRICITY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as BRIGHT FLASHES OF BLUE LIGHT strobe-under the surface. ARCING CURRENT chases up the anchor cable, sparking  across the hoist.

dialogues.speaker: WATER
dialogues.text: as the electricity feeding the streetlights is abruptly  extinguished, plunging the campsite into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Suzy's eyes flash open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what? He pulls her back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, I'm serious. He knows the mood is broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, I'll check it out. He slips on his jeans, exiting the cabin. She pulls the  sheet up around her fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT, (TANK)
dialogues.text: as the cable smolders, void of electricity now. TRACK to  find the chains again...but they're dangling loosely.  JASON IS GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suzy is tensely kneeling on the bed now. The black void  of night is all she sees out the cabin door, which Jim  has left open. An uncomfortable amount of time passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy...? No answer. Her heart starts to pound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim...? Again, nothing. She wraps herself in the sheet, moving  towards the open door. The ship creaks again.

dialogues.speaker: SUZY'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as she grows closer to the doorway, nothing but pitch- black beyond it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop screwing around, Jim. I mean  it... ...And just as she reaches the door:

dialogues.speaker: A HOCKEY MASKED MONSTER
dialogues.text: leaps out, clutching a HUGE KNIFE. Suzy barely has time  to scream before JASON PLUNGES THE KNIFE INTO HER CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: SUZY
dialogues.text: stands there in speechless shock, looking down at her  mortal wound. But there's no blood.

dialogues.speaker: THE MONSTER
dialogues.text: pulls the knife back out, pushing the blade in and out  with his hand. It's a retractable rubber knife. JIM  pulls off the hockey mask with a huge grin, tossing it  aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha good, baby cakes. She doesn't know whether to hug him with relief or kick  him in the balls. He pulls her back onto the bed,  laughing.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY MASK
dialogues.text: sitting dormant on the deck, where Jim tossed it. A  SHADOW FALLS ACROSS IT...followed by a SLIMY, DECOMPOSING HAND. The hand grabs it like it's an old friend, pulling  it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jim holds his angry girlfriend down on the bed, trying unsuccessfully to kiss her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right -- I'm a major  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you'll never do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll never do it again. Forgive  me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's resisting only for effect. Her legs curl around  him, finally giving in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deadly-sharp SPEAR GUN rests in its rack outside the  cabin. JASON'S HAND REMOVES IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheets begin to roll like waves as they work each  other. Thoughts of Jason are nonexistent now.

dialogues.speaker: CABIN DOOR
dialogues.text: Nothing there for a moment...then a pair of moss-covered  BARE FEET SLOSH INTO FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: SUZY
dialogues.text: closes her eyes with pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: CABIN DOOR
dialogues.text: ...and camera RISES from the mossy feet, up the bloodless legs and torso to ultimately reveal the hockey-masked  face of our anti-hero: JASON VOORHEES.

dialogues.speaker: SUZY
dialogues.text: lets out a broad smile, her eyelids fluttering. They stay open long enough to regard the visitor in the doorway.  She tries to choke out a warning to Jim, who's just  collapsed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JJJJJJJJason... He doesn't follow her glance, smiling instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. You must really think I'm an  ass. But she continues to stare in horror as:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: raises the spear, taking aim.

dialogues.speaker: SUZY AND JIM
dialogues.text: Hs starts to kiss her but she bolts up with a blood- curdling SCREAM. A second later, JASON FIRES THE SPEAR,  PIERCING HER NECK, PINNING HER TO THE HEAD BOARD. Jim stares point-blank at his dead girlfriend, not able  to assimilate it quickly enough. He spins around to see  the monster himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohmygod... Jim springs off the bed, looking around for anything to  defend himself with, grabbing the bedside lamp. He  SMASHES IT OVER JASON'S HEAD which has little effect. Jim scrambles to get past him, but Jason LIFTS JIM IN THE  AIR, SLAMMING HIM DOWN ON ONE OF THE SPIKED BEDPOSTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the HOUSEBOAT silently drifts onward. The lone  silhouette of Jason emerges from within, taking the helm. He's back.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Only the faintest sign of daylight can be seen through a  thick blanket of gray fog. In the distance, speckled  lights outlining a smaller LUXURY CRUISE SHIP  intermittently appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing at the boarding ramp is CHARLES MCCULLOCH,  clipboard in hand. He's just finished checking off a pair of new-agey SENIOR GIRLS. McCulloch is approaching fifty, wearing a tie and unwrinkled clothes, as well as the  disposition of a stern puritan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember girls, the shuffleboard  tournament will start at six p.m.  sharp. A non-attendance will restrict  your time in port, understood? They nod for his benefit, exchanging derogatory whispers  as they head up the ramp. Camera ADJUSTS to find a small  parking lot adjacent to the docks, where several cars are just now arriving -- parents dropping off their high  school seniors, hugging them bon voyage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as SEAN ROBERTSON walks toward the ship with pal MILES  WOLFE. Sean's a tall, nice looking, somewhat serious guy; Miles is shorter, athletic and more extroverted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me this boat has a pool  with a three meter board?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a ship and that's right. Plus a  disco, gym, game room and a lot more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna blow off New York  and just stay on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do no such thing, Mr. Wolfe...  Camera ADJUSTS to reveal McCulloch, holding his list,  checking off their names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your itinerary has been carefully  planned and make no mistake, it will  be executed accordingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course...wouldn't want to risk  enjoying this trip. McCulloch gives him a frown. Sean steps up to him  tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which cabin is Rennie in, Mr.  McCulloch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie's not coming. He's devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She changed her mind. (eyeing list)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see...Mr. Wolfe is in stateroom  one-eleven and you, Mr. Robertson, are  in two-twenty-five. A booming VOICE from above interrupts them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean -- where the hell have you been?  We're already into early departure  protocol...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing on the upper deck is a no-nonsense, uniformed  Navy man, ADMIRAL ROBERTSON. The captain of the ship. And Sean's father. Sean's sadness about Rennie's absence is  immediately replaced with anxiety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right up, Dad. He and Miles head up the gangway, both boys giving  McCulloch one last glare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the wheel is MISS COLLEEN VAN DEUSEN, thirties,  attractive, a progressive attitude. RENNIE WICKHAM sits  next to her -- she's seventeen, pretty, slightly  withdrawn. Rennie's dog TOBY, a border collie, rides in  the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you decided to come after  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. But I'm not sure Uncle Charles  will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me worry about him, okay? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personal experiences are what fuel the  minds of great writers, Rennie. You  made the right decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about not-so-great writers? Rennie smiles self-deprecatingly, Miss Van Deusen  grinning back. But Rennie's smiles are few and far  between, this one disappearing as she glances out the  window.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as the countless gallons of harbor and lake water spread  out before her, eery in the bog. A small ROWBOAT grazes  across it occupied by two indistinguishable people.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: Rennie's eyes show a hidden terror. She quickly turns  away, shivering briefly. Miss Van Deusen notices. She  turns a corner, heading into the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just felt a little chill. Rennie rubs her arms, faking coldness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know that I'm giving up  teaching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since the school is closing anyway,  I'm going to write that novel I've  been threatening on everybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's wonderful, Miss Van  Deusen...what's it about? She parks the car, turning off the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A senior class cruise to Manhattan,  laced with romance, adventure and  murder. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or a Gothic cook book. I haven't  decided which. She's coaxed the smile out of Rennie again. Miss Van  Deusen pulls a small wrapped box from her glove  compartment, handing it to Rennie, who seems utterly  surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, open it. Rennie pops off the lid, revealing an antique ink-dip  pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stephen King supposedly used it when  he was in high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie, you're the best student I ever  had...you have a real gift. If anybody  can make use of that pen, it's you. Rennie hugs her teacher. Camera RISES above the car's  window, finding a Mercedes 560 SL pulling in a short  distance away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sexy, money-dressed blonde is behind the wheel. TAMARA  MASON. She climbs from her leather seats as a trio of  SENIOR GIRLS walk by, offering enthusiastic hi's and  hellos. She's obviously Miss Popular. Tamara crosses to a cute Japanese girl unloading luggage from a beige Honda,  EVA WATANABE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready for drugs, sex and rock  'n roll or what, girl? Eva gives her a warning glance, nodding to her left.  Eva's MOTHER appears by the passenger door, forcing a  smile at Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Watanabe. Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I'm sure. Embarrassed, Eva hurries to her Mom, rushing a kiss  goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about a thing, Mom. I'll  have a terrific time and I won't do  anything stupid, okay? Before Mrs. Watanabe can squeeze a word in, her daughter  is gone. She waves a bittersweet goodbye to her graduate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA AND EVA
dialogues.text: Once they're out of Mrs. Watanabe's earshot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear the crew members are cute guys  in their twenties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure we'll have no problem getting  them to party with us...especially  with this. Tamara unzips her purse, revealing a baggie filled with  fine white powder. Eva looks very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my graduation gift from Daddy. It  cost over a thousand bucks but it's  the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bought you that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More or less. It's part of my college  fund.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grins coquettishly, walking on. Camera HOLDS on the  calm, foggy harbor...where the faint image of a HOUSEBOAT is aimlessly drifting into port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, it's the same one we saw JASON on last  night...but no one is behind the helm. It seems to be a  ghost ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara tries to slip past McCulloch, busy with another pair of seniors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop right there, Miss Mason. He motions the others onward. Busted. Tamara instantly  hands Eva her drug-filled purse, paralyzing Eva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only graduating seniors are allowed on  this cruise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never turned in your final biology  project, so I've had your diploma  rescinded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already been done. (turning to Eva)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations on the 3.9 average,  Miss Watanabe. You're in stateroom two- fifty-five. Eva smiles awkwardly, reaching for her luggage, stalling  to see what happens with Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Mr. McCulloch, I got in a car  accident yesterday and missed our  appointment. It's okay, no big deal,  just a bruised arm... (squeezes her arm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so I brought my project along  today. It's in my suitcase. Really. He looks at her suitcase, not buying a word of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's telling the truth, Mr.  McCulloch. I saw her pack it. He's surprised to hear this...and so is Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. But if it mysteriously  disappears en route, I'll have you  sent back home the minute we dock.  Understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfectly. She grabs her purse back from Eva, quickly moving on  before he changes his mind. Their voices become whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A major prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Improvise, of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the HOUSEBOAT haphazardly bumps into barnacle-covered  dock pilings, still around fifty yards from the cruise  ship.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW OUT HOUSEBOAT WINDOW
dialogues.text: The window is splattered with blood, but still clear  enough to make out Tamara and Eva walking up the gangway, along with a half dozen other teenagers mingling on  board.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON HOUSEBOAT'S ANCHOR CABLE
dialogues.text: --or rather the remnants of it. It's a piece of frayed  woven metal charred by extreme electricity, severed just  above water level. Suddenly there's blurry movement  behind it; camera RACK FOCUSES just in time to catch a  glimpse of JASON SLIPPING OFF THE SIDE, FLOATING TOWARDS  THE PILINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch impatiently checks his watch and list again. Miss Van Deusen walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Charles. Has everyone checked  in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim Miller and Suzy Donaldson never  showed up. I'm a little concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be. They probably decided to  explore each other rather than New  York. He gives her a disdainful look, starting up the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go -- we're running two minutes  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles, there's someone else coming  along too. He stops, following her glance. His face tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie is walking toward them with a small suitcase, her  dog Toby striding next to her. She walks up to him,  starts to say something, then decides against it. Rennie  heads up the gangway. HOLD on McCulloch and Miss Van  Deusen. He's livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And neither do you. It's up to Rennie to decide what she wants to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what she wants. She's  never had a stable life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she sure doesn't have one now,  either. She needs to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm her legal guardian, not you or  anybody else, and I alone know what's  best for her. End of discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think it's just the beginning. She walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she reaches the top of the gangway, her heart  pounding. Rennie pauses, working up the courage to look  out at the lake again.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: The ROWBOAT she saw earlier is still there, even closer  now.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S PUPILS
dialogues.text: contract, her blood pumping faster. Then she hears a  FAINT VOICE BELOW HER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp me... Rennie looks straight down at the water beneath her and  sees:

dialogues.speaker: AN EIGHT YEAR OLD BOY
dialogues.text: floundering in the water. It takes us only a moment to  recognize him -- IT'S YOUNG JASON. He's gasping, sucking  in huge amounts of liquid, exactly like he did in the  prologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: leans back in terror, falling into Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Rennie?? Rennie frantically points over the ramp edge, unable to  speak. Miss Van Deusen quickly looks and sees:

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: The water is calm. No Young Jason.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as Rennie gets a hold of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got a little dizzy. I'm fine. She continues up the ramp. HOLD on Miss Van Deusen,  watching her go, somewhat troubled by it. RACK to  McCulloch below her, also watching. Extremely concerned.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: continues along the starboard side, not risking another  glance overboard. She passes an older, very deranged DECK HAND, mopping the deck. HOLD on him, his bloodshot eyes  following her like a crazed raven.

dialogues.speaker: HARPOON
dialogues.text: Sharp and rusty, mounted on the wall amidst jagged  scaling knives, shark jaws and other artifacts. WIDEN to  reveal they are surrounding a navigational chart on the  cruise ship's bridge. Admiral Robertson and his CHIEF  ENGINEER are preparing for departure, checking the OMEGA  satellite computer as well as the LORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's take in the brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir. (into intercom phone.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take in the gangway and single up all  lines. SEAN and MILES enter the room; Sean gets a glance from  his Dad. Miles is very impressed with the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Admiral Robertson. Love your  ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a beauty, isn't she? I should've  retired from the Navy ten years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've really been generous to give us  this cruise. I know I speak for  everybody on board. Everybody...with the possible exception of Sean. He  avoids eye contact with his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, there's just twenty or so of you  -- we only need a skeleton crew and  it's a pleasure to sail her anyway. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, congratulations on winning  the intramural diving championships,  Miles. I'm sure you made your old man  proud. Admiral Robertson gives his own son a glance; maybe Sean  should think about doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided on your departure  protocol, Admiral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I thought I'd leave the  honors to my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I don't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chief Engineer, ignoring  Sean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relinquishing command of the Princess  Ruby to Captain Sean Robertson. Sean has no say in the matter. Miles can feel his  friend's nervousness as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before you take the helm, take  this. He tosses Sean a wrapped box. Sean opens it. Inside is a  navigational computer the size of a calculator, sitting  next to a rusty old sextant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something old and something new. I  used the sextant when I was your age,  but now they have these goddamn  computers to do all the work for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you decided on a plan of  departure, Captain? Sean's nervous. He eyes the Omega, quickly glancing at  the LORAN, briefly referring to the navigational chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about if we start up the forward  engines and come around. 180  degrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you forgetting something? Sean looks flustered. Admiral Robertson storms to a  large button, pressing it three times, piercing the air  with three long blasts of the ship's horn. It  underscores his frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in foggy weather! Send out the  international maritime signal that a  vessel is backing down, followed by a  security broadcast warning other  ships! He shoves the mike out at Sean, but he doesn't grab it,  leaving the bridge, humiliated. There's an awkward moment for Miles, unable to find any appropriate words. He exits as well. Admiral Robertson stares out the bridge window,  saddened and frustrated. It wasn't supposed to go this  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as he continues away, his retreat blocked by the DECK  HAND. The crazy old man pierces a dead serious stare at  Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This voyage is doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, tell me about it. Sean sidesteps him, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parents and relatives wave gleefully from the docks as  CAMERA RISES AND ROTATES to find eighteen or so teenagers 1ining the upper deck, happily waving back. The ship  begins to slice through serene water. The voyage has  begun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water begins to ripple as the ship's speed increases. All seems normal...until JASON'S HANDS APPEAR, CLINGING  TO A LOOSE MOORING LINE DRAGGING IN THE WATER. He  slithers up the side towards the deck as dense fog  breezes past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean continues along, hands in pockets. He turns a  corner and collides with RENNIE, walking her dog. His  eyes instantly brighten, as do hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you weren't coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glances at Toby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We changed our minds. Sean pats her dog. There's an awkward pause...they are  obviously in the early stages-of a relationship.  Sean reaches into his coat pocket, bringing back a small  necklace-sized box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't get you one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's a dumb little thing  anyway. Rennie opens it up, exposing a petite silver necklace  with a Statue of Liberty pendant on it. She's touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean...it's beautiful. Sean takes it from her, snapping it around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe we could hike to the  top of the Statue when we got there,  if you felt like it. It's supposed to  be 22 stories tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was looking for you, Mr.  Robertson. McCulloch appears behind them. The mood has been broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I'll see you later. Sean leaves. McCulloch steps up to Rennie, pointing out  to the foggy sea. Her respiration increases as she  psyches herself up to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a storm predicted tonight.  Rennie looks at the ocean, forcing herself not to turn  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a big mistake, Rennie.  It's not too late to put you back on  land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Miss Van Deusen knew how afraid you  were of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't push me into coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know why I'm afraid,  Uncle Charles. I can't even remember  when it started. Don't you think it's  time I found out and got over it? He takes a measured pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing your fear doesn't always  conquer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm staying. He's not going to change her mind. P.O.V. - RENNIE AND MCCULLOCH (B & W/VIEWFINDER MATTE through a porthole window...and through the viewfinder  of a video camcorder. McCulloch shakes his head, turning  away from Rennie and walking away. A sinister electric  guitar solo screeches out. PAN with McCulloch as he  passes the window, coming around 180 degrees into a CLOSE UP of J.J. JARRETT, fingering a sleek Gibson "Flying V."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into camera)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this axe awesome or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as J.J., a female rocker in the vein of band "Vixen,"  continues to wail on her guitar. She's wearing a black  leather corset, with wildly teased deep red hair. Holding the camcorder is WAYNE WEBBER, MTV-acclimated, wearing  the latest hip prescription glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too cool, J.J. Your parents came  through. She pops out the guitar cable from her practice amp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No lie. I hear there's a big power  room down below where I can get  supreme concert hall echo. Come down  and shoot a basement tape on me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...but I gotta shoot some  shockumentary footage first. He avoids eye contact when he says it. She gives him a  look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, don't tell me you're still trying  to scam on Tamara... His non-answer means yes. J.J. walks over to him,  grabbing his cheeks, shaking them like jello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have we known each other?  Don't be a dweeb, Wayne. She's not  interested in you, only what you can  do for her. She's a user.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So's this guitar. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He exits. She mumbles something under her breath, coiling up her amp cord.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: as he walks onward. DROP DOWN to find his FEET as he  passes a DARK ALCOVE...which happens to have SLIMY  FOOTPRINTS AND SEAWEED leading into it. Camera FOLLOWS  the footprints, RISING again and with dim recognition,  our eyes fall on JASON. Lurking in the shadows. But not  for long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Massive, very dark, backlit steam seeping from a maze of  pipes overhead. No windows. A wall of circuit breakers  and voltage meters decorate one wall, quietly humming  generators on the opposite side. J.J. appears with her  guitar, amp and ghetto blaster, appreciative of the  surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is aching for a video.  Wayne, you're an asshole. She finds an outlet and plugs in her equipment.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: We're peering at J.J. predatorially through the steam,  moving through it, behind the generators. J.J. pops a cassette into her blaster, jamming the "play"  button. A loud rock 'n roll rhythm track blasts out.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: moving around the generators, eyeing her sleek leather  pants as she bends over to plug in her axe.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON ELECTRIC GUITAR
dialogues.text: as J.J. snaps the male end of the plug into the female.  receptacle.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S FACE
dialogues.text: appears for an instant through the vapor, then vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: J.J.
dialogues.text: screams out the opening licks of her solo in sync with  her playback. The generators are causing a breeze which  makes her hair dance, steam flowing between her legs.  She's lost in her music, building to a crescendo, bending the high "E" string above the upper octave fret. She  opens her eyes with the pleasure of it and sees:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: emerging from a cloud of vapor like her worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as J.J.'s SCREAM echoes from an exhaust duct. WHIP PAN to find the crazed DECK HAND standing just below it,  reacting with dread. He's the only one who has heard it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jason tears the guitar off her body, raising it in the air like a hatchet. The horrified girl flees down a  narrow maze of steel steps, forced back against a  generator with nowhere to go. PUSH IN on her face for one last look at her before:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: swings the guitar downward and buries it in J.J.'s skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the Deck Hand flinches upon the thick, dull sound of  her demise, followed by discordant feedback from her  guitar...and eventual silence. He reaches into his breast pocket, his hand shaking badly as he sips from a flask of Early Times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as LIGHTNING FLASHES over a gray, choppy sea. A storm is  imminent. The Princess Ruby finally appears, cutting  through whitecaps, no land in sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie's hand carefully dips it in India ink, moving  to a blank page in her journal. She hesitates for several beats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No inspiration. She puts down the pen, looking at her  dog, who's curled up on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think...time for some  personal experiences to fuel our  minds? The dog's eyes blink, but no more than that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. Rennie moves to her closet, finding a silk blouse and  some black satin pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind is picking up, sweeping thick mist past a row of  decorative flags. One of them flaps back...AND EXPOSES  JASON.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH JASON'S EYES, (FLYING WALL EFX)
dialogues.text: as the flag whips our faces. We MOVE through it, down the empty passageway, coming to a porthole window. Rennie's  window. We peer through it with unnerving intensity at  the backside of Rennie as she pulls off her T-shirt,  slipping on the blouse. Camera continues through the  tiny round window, floating across the room, over Toby  and the bed...until we're INCHES FROM THE BACK OF  RENNIE'S HEAD. She suddenly spins around in fright,  facing us point-blank, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is there, her porthole window empty. But there's  something surreal about the window...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON PORTHOLE WINDOW, (EFX)
dialogues.text: Empty grayness...then EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON FLOATS UP FROM BELOW, BUBBLES ESCAPING FROM HIS LIPS. The porthole has  become a window into the depths of Crystal Lake.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: feels her throat catch with terror and an instant later:

dialogues.speaker: DOG TOBY
dialogues.text: begins to bark vociferously, rushing to her cabin door,  scratching to get out.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S EYES
dialogues.text: are distracted to Toby for a second; when she looks back  at the porthole, she sees:

dialogues.speaker: AN EMPTY WINDOW
dialogues.text: No water, no drowning boy.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: snaps out of it, moving to the door, where her dog is  frantically clawing with his fur up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Toby, calm down... She's talking to herself as much as the dog. Rennie  closes the curtains on her window, then steps to her  door. She swings the door open for Toby...and exposes  an empty hall. Toby scrapes his way out of the room,  dashing off down the hall, snarling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Toby runs straight toward us. PAN with him as he  rushes around a corner, leading us into a view of TAMARA  and EVA, disappearing down a staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong seventeen year-old black kid, JULIUS GAW, is  going a few rounds with another senior boy who's clearly  losing the boxing match. Julius dances around him on the  mat like he's Mike Tyson, several other boys cheering  them on.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER ROOM WINDOW
dialogues.text: as Tamara and Eva step into view. Eva glances around,  feeling out of place in the men's locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure we're supposed to be  here, Tamara. A couple of skinny boys wearing only towels walk by. But  Tamara doesn't notice them, her face pressed up against  the glass, watching Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a muscular bod or what? Tamara puts on a sexy smile. The other boxer sees her  instead, instantly distracted. Julius lays him out with a left-right-left combination. The onlookers applaud.  Julius pulls out his mouthpiece, giving Tamara a wicked  smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's undefeated, you know that? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius is the only senior I'd even  consider doing it with. If he wasn't  black, that is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awkward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents are open minded about that  sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My stepmom couldn't care less, but  Daddy would have a shit fit. (lets it slip out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might even pay some attention to  me. Tamara quickly puts up her veneer again, spotting  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous guy at ten o'clock. Look  sensual. Both girls slip into instant sultry as a CREW MEMBER in  his mid-twenties passes them, wearing a tool belt. Very  masculine. He gives the girls a pleasant smile. Tamara  turns around to check out his back side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time for some  recreational activity, girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good. I hear there's a  shuffleboard court on deck -- it might  be kinds cool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking, right? She wasn't, but Eva tries to act like she was. Tamara  walks on, Eva following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch steps from Rennie's room, looking very  worried. Wayne Webber passes by, his eye stuck in his  viewfinder. McCulloch yanks the camcorder away from his  face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my niece anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, motivating downstairs, I think.  What's the problem, Mr. McCulloch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior predictions started five  minutes ago and she hasn't shown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of us don't want our futures  predicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your case I'm sure that's true. He brushes past Wayne angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara drags Eva into a secluded service area, pulling out her mirror, straw and baggie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night time is the right time.  Tamara hands the straw to Eva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Don't be a lightweight...this is  top dollar toot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that, it's just that... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It I get caught, I'll lose my science  scholarship and everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking to the prom queen,  Eva. Do you really think I'm going to  risk getting caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you realize how many people would  kill to be sitting here right now?  Come on, it's grad night. You've got  your whole life to be uptight. Eva takes the straw.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as we move down the corridor, in and out of shadows,  hearing giggles from Tamara and Eva up ahead. Jason's  coming...

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA AND EVA
dialogues.text: as Eva takes a nosefull, sneezing badly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that unbelievable or what? Tamara giggles, getting ready to tap out another line.  But the snickering stops upon the sound of APPROACHING  FOOTSTEPS. They both look up, every muscle tensing with  fear as:

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: appears from the shadows, just as startled to see them.  It's not Jason at all. Rennie can't help noticing the  cocaine, trying hard to ignore it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you scared the hell out of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my dog? I think he came  this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we haven't. (awkwardly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care for a hit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. Rennie continues on. After she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A real space cadet. I wonder if she'll  narc on us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have her in Creative Writing and  she's fairly nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody related to McCulloch can be  nice. Tamara puts the straw to her nose.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: as she presses on, the corridor getting darker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby? No reply. She walks on, turning down the left hallway...  but camera turns down the right hallway. Suddenly JASON  REVEALS HIMSELF, quietly stepping from the GAME ROOM.  He's holding a pool cue, which he proceeds to snap in  half, providing a splintery sharp shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara finishes off her line, wiping her nose with a  sniffle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Ready to party and then some. She rolls up her baggie, stuffing it into her purse.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as we come down a corridor, turning into the Service  Area, stomping right up to Tamara and Eva. They both  GASP; Tamara drops her mirror, which SHATTERS on the  ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are facing McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. He eyes the broken mirror. He wasn't born yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you girls using drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I would use drugs, Mr.  McCulloch? We were just exploring the  ship. He doesn't want to believe Eva is a druggie. But Tamara  is a different matter. He levels his eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'11 be coming around your stateroom  in exactly fifteen minutes, Miss  Mason. You'd better have your biology  project ready or I'm phoning your  parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll make sure you remain on  board while your classmates see the  sights. He's gotten to her with that one. McCulloch storms away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, I've got McCulloch covered...  but that little narcing bitch niece of  his is a different matter. (calculating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumor has it she's a teensy bit afraid  of the water...

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH
dialogues.text: as a body pierces the surface of the deck swimming pool.  It's MILES, having just completed a dive from the high  board. Miss Van Deusen and several others stand at  poolside, giving him some applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poetry in motion, Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half-twist short. I'll hone that  dive yet. He swims to the side, leading us to a view of Rennie.  She's very cautious about getting too close to the pool  edge as she approaches Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie -- I was just on my way over to  your room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my dog anywhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm sure Toby's fine. The  ship's only so big and there's  certainly no way off it, is there? She smiles reassuringly, but her words are less than  comforting.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: as the canine continues to sniff out Jason through the  maze of corridors. TRACK with the dog as he slows his  pace, knowing he's getting close to something.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY'S POINT OF VIEW, (STEADICAM)
dialogues.text: Low to the ground, creeping past a steam vent which  obscures his vision, then turning down a metal staircase, weaving into another passageway. Then with absolutely no  warning, A BODY FALLS FROM ABOVE, THUDDING DIRECTLY IN  FRONT OF US.

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: rears back with teeth bared, but:

dialogues.speaker: THE BODY
dialogues.text: is quite dead: Toby is snarling at the corpse of the  TEENAGE BOXER who lost his bout against Julius. He's  still in his boxing shorts...BUT JASON'S SPLINTERY POOL  CUE HAS BEEN STABBED THROUGH HIS CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they walk along the edge of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, are you having fun yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I seem to detect a hint of  ingenuousness in your tone. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In other words, level with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something I haven't told  you... ...But before she can begin the next sentence, Rennie is  shoved from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she SPLASHES INTO THE POOL'S DEEP END.

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
dialogues.text: spins around, seeing Tamara standing there with Eva.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, sorry...

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: flounders at the surface, nobody realizing the terror  she's experiencing. She's too scared to even cry for  help.

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
dialogues.text: isn't looking at Rennie, her attention on admonishing  Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why on earth would you do something  like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an accident, I swear... Eva avoids eye contact, feeling awful. Sean comes walking up, seeing Rennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? (to Rennie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: She's can't even hear Sean, her vision being splashed by  the chlorinated water. She sinks under the surface,  turning around...AND COMING FACE TO FACE WITH YOUNG  JASON. The eight year-old corpse GRABS HER ANKLE AND  TRIES TO DRAG HER DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as Rennie sinks under the surface, all alone, thrashing  in terror.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: realizes she's in trouble. He immediately dives in after  her, pulling her to the pool's edge, where Miss Van  Deusen helps to lift her out.

dialogues.speaker: TAMARA AND EVA
dialogues.text: quickly move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was truly excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feels like shit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to check out the waiters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll pass. See you later,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...wait a minute! Eva walks away. Tamara acts angry, but deep down she's  hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some friend you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean climbs from the pool to join Miss Van Deusen, who is trying to comfort Rennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sean)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring her a towel, okay? Sean nods, hurrying off as others start to crowd around.  Miss Van Deusen looks up at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine -- everybody go back to  what you were doing. They disperse. Rennie slowly starts to cry, holding tight to her teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Care to talk about it? After a moment to compose herself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gathered that. Rennie says nothing else. Miss Van Deusen knows she's  holding out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a skiing accident in high  school, broke my left leg. It took  three winters before I would even look  at the snow again...but the solution  kept eluding me. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally took lessons. I've never  broken a bone since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. But you're not telling me  everything, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whenever I get near the water, I see  this young boy drowning. He tries to  pull me down with him. The teacher didn't expect this, taking a thoughtful  pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did this start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About four years ago...at Crystal  Lake. I spent a few summers there with  Uncle Charles inbetween boarding  school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After your parents passed away? Rennie nods somberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have an accident in the lake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was just a normal summer. I've  never been able to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one young boy ever drowned in  that lake, and that was before you  were even born. His name was Jason  Voorhees. The name has triggered some deep memory...but the  recollection vanishes upon the sound of her uncle's  voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch rushes over to Rennie, seeing that she's  soaked. He's livid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine, Charles. Take it easy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I can see that. You've done a  wonderful job of supervising the kids,  Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't her fault. He gets Rennie to her feet just as Sean runs back with a  towel. McCulloch grabs it from him, wrapping it around  his niece, facing both Miss Van Deusen and Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away from her...both of you. He starts to lead her away. The crazy DECK HAND blocks  their path, slipping his flask away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's come back and you're all going to  die. Rennie gazes at the Deck Hand, then back at McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...leave me alone... She pulls away from him, hurrying off, confused and  frightened. McCulloch's retinas pierce the Deck Hand with scorn. He checks his watch, then storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a loud, firm KNOCK punctuates the silence. Then comes  a sultry voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's open. McCulloch swings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in no mood for any more stall  tactics, Miss Mason. Where is your  final project?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara fills a pair of champagne glasses with a bottle of Dom Perignon. She's wearing a full body robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't you like a glass of champagne  first, Charles? He's about to lose his temper. McCulloch steps closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get that alcohol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I packed it. Just for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we approach Tamara's porthole window, peering through  it. We can't hear the words but we can clearly see the  people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch takes the bottle from her, setting it down  on her nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. You're not setting foot off  this ship until we return home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I haven't even shown you my  biology project... Tamara unties her robe. PAN DOWN to the floor with it as  it softly piles at her bare feet.

dialogues.speaker: PORTHOLE WINDOW
dialogues.text: as the SHADOW OUTSIDE quickly blurs past the window.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: McCulloch is flabbergasted, too stunned to fully react.  Tamara is wearing a layered teddy, which she's beginning  to unsnap, exposing her lithe body...but that's not all.  Tamara has drawn all her major organs on her bare skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a closer look, Charles. I want to  make sure I labeled all my organs  correctly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as we approach her door, still cracked open from  McCulloch's entrance. We get there just in time to see  Tamara slip her arms around McCulloch, planting her lips  on his, pressing her nubile flesh up against his stiffly  starched shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she holds him tight. He finally breaks away in a fit  of anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you've done it now. Not only are  you going home, I'll see to it that  you spend next year back in a high  school classroom! He storms for the door, swinging it open, coming face to  face with:

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: who casually lowers his camcorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so, Mr. McCulloch. (to Wayne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get anything good? His eyes are unable to leave her nakedness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. She quickly slips on her robe again, all business.  McCulloch realizes what has just transpired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get away with it. (eyeing Wayne)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can forget about ever  attending any film school. (serious beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're both going to be very, very  sorry. He storms off. Wayne looks very, very nervous. Tamara  steps over to him, cuddling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Wayne. He won't risk doing a  thing. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have the tape? He pops the eject button, absently handing it over. Wayne steps into her room, nervous and excited to be there. He  lifts the glass of champagne she poured for McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to sound supremely  lame...but I've had the major hots for  you since our sophomore year, Tamara. He gulps down the fizz. She forces a smile, stashing the  incriminating videotape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet, Wayne. Look, I'd love to  chat but I'm really pressed for time. (ushering him to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's try to get together later, okey- doke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the camerawork. And out he goes, the door shut in his face. Wayne stands  outside her room, realizing he's a major chump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne, you're an asshole. He despondently exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara heads for the bathroom, slipping off her robe.  She moves to the shower curtain and we're right behind  her. Her hand reaches up, grabbing the curtain, yanking  it back... Nothing is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie enters, her eyes reddened. She moves to the  sink, looking at herself in the mirror. So much for the  silk blouse and satin pants, not to mention her soaked  hair. Rennie runs some warm water, rinsing her face. When she starts to fill her hands a second time, BLOOD  POURS OUT THE FAUCET INSTEAD OF WATER. Rennie gasps,  jerking up and seeing YOUNG JASON REFLECTED ON THE OTHER  SIDE OF THE MIRROR, SPLASHING IN WATER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not real, it's not real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as water from the shower head SPLASHES CAMERA for a beat  before Tamara turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Tamara reaches for her robe, slipping it on. Her body  paint has been washed off.  She steps from the shower, glancing in her vanity mirror  AND SEEING THE REAL JASON REFLECTED IN IT. Tamara spins  around, looking face to face with JASON IN HER BATHROOM.  Just as she SCREAMS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Jason reaches out to grab Rennie, HIS FIST CRASHING THROUGH THE MIRROR. Right when Rennie SCREAMS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Jason SHATTERS TAMARA'S VANITY MIRROR WITH HIS  FIST. He grabs a sharp chunk of it, advancing on a  whimpering Tamara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...please don't... Jason raises the shard above her and just as she  SHRIEKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it blasts loudly in the bleak stormy night. It begins  to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie comes rushing out, right into the arms of.  Sean. She clings to him, sobbing as the rain falls over  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...you're going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to go home. I want off this  ship. After a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go talk to my Dad. He puts his arm around her, leading her toward the  bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as wind and rain pummel the bridge window.. Admiral  Robertson turns to his Chief Engineer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's kick in the stablilizers, Mr.  Carlson, and get the seas off the  quarter. These kids are in for one  hell of a storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Sir. Activating comfort cruise  mode. The Chief Engineer moves to a bank of toggle switches,  flipping a row of them.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON NAVIGATIONAL CHART WALL
dialogues.text: as a bloodstained HAND silently removes the rusty  harpoon hanging above the map.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL ROBERTSON
dialogues.text: gets a reflective look in his weary eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How olds your boy now, Carlson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nineteen months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tremendous age. Take some advice  from a salty old man: don't push him  too hard. The Chief Engineer nods with a sympathetic smile as the  Admiral steps off the bridge, onto the stormy deck,  contemplating the sea. The Chief Engineer moves to the  radio/intercom console. He lifts a telephone, punching in a three digit number. PUSH IN TIGHT ON HIS FACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the bridge. Approaching  weather suggests we secure the main  deck and... His sentence is sharply cut off, his head jerking from  excruciating, instant pain.  His mouth contorts with words no one will ever hear as he stares into the face of:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: holding the opposite end of the harpoon. He shoves it  forward with one more staccato jerk and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The harpoon's bloody, corroded tip pierces through  his once-white uniform.

dialogues.speaker: ADMIRAL ROBERTSON
dialogues.text: returns to the bridge as LIGHTNING flashes outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better have them doublecheck the  lifeboat stations as well... Admiral Robertson stops cold upon the sight of Mr.  Carlson. He hurries over to him, kneeling down, freezing  as a pair of MUDDY FEET ENTER FRAME. Admiral Robertson  bends his neck upwards to face:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: hovering over him, now clutching one of the scaling  knives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean and Rennie walk up the corridor leading to the  bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he really take us home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not completing a voyage is against  everything he stands for. But I think  I can convince him to call a Coast  Guard cutter for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I go with you, he'll never speak to me again. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm never going to live up to his  expectations anyway...so maybe it's  the right thing to do. He's made a big decision. Sean takes her hand as they  walk on.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: moving closer and closer to the bridge door, having not  the slightest inclination of what's in store for them.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: knocks on the bridge door. No answer. He's confused. He  pushes the door open but something is blocking it. Sean  puts his weight into it, shoving hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the door slides open, Sean stepping inside. His eyes  roil downwards upon seeing THE DEAD CHIEF ENGINEER, THE  HARPOON PROTRUDING FROM HIS BLOODY CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus...Dad?? Sean looks over at the helm...where his father is still  sitting in the swivel chair, his back to them. Silent.  Sean sidesteps the Chief Engineer's corpse, moving toward his father as Rennie remains frozen in shock.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Slowly walking toward Admiral Robertson...at least he  thinks it's his dad because he's unable to see his  face. Is it Jason now wearing the uniform?? When he's  about two feet away from him...

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
dialogues.text: reaches out and swivels the chair around. It is his  father BUT HIS THROAT HAS BEEN SLIT. Sean staggers  backwards, uncomprehending, his senses overloaded. We  MOVE with him until he's backed into Rennie, clutching  onto him tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's...he's dead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miss Van Deusen steps up to Rennie's door, gently  knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ronnie? I just came by to see how you  were feeling... No answer. She knocks harder...and it creaks open,  unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie...? Suddenly the door is jerked from her grasp and swung  open. MCCULLOCH is standing on the other side of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you to stay away from  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds her ground)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accusing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a very good question and I'd  appreciate an answer. A LOUD BUZZER blares out of an intercom speaker next to  their heads, causing the teachers to both jump. Sean's  unsteady voice immediately follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention everybody, attention. This  is Sean Robertson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles is toweling off under the shelter of a gazebo as  Sean's voice blares out of a rain-pounded megaphone  speaker nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been... (swallows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I mean is, this is an  emergency... Miles knows he can't be joking around. Wayne comes  walking by, covering his camcorder with his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles -- have you seen J.J.? She was  supposed to be jamming down in the  power room but... Miles gestures for him to be quiet, listening very  worriedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeat, this is an emergency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as JULIUS and two other senior boys finish dressing after a shower, hearing Sean's words reverberate around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want everybody to meet on the  bridge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this? The others shrug, concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wooden shuffleboard disks are drowning in  precipitation. Eva stands alone in the rain, staring at  the court as Sean's voice continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay calm, but get here as quick as  possible. Walk with a friend if you  can... Eva wipes the rain from her face, then walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: trying his best to keep it together. He glances at his  dead father, still unable to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I wish this was a joke, but it's  not. Sean slowly puts down the phone. He's lost in a daze.  Suddenly the SHIP LURCHES, a huge swell SPLASHING THE  BRIDGE WINDOW. Admiral Robertson's body falls from the  swivel chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is happening??? Sean regains his balance, moving to the computer console, looking at the OMEGA and LORAN like he's never seen them  before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...we've gone off course  or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean??? Another wave hammers the bow. She's in a state of awful  panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I mean! All's I know  is that there's no one guiding this  ship anymore... Sean is starting to lose it. The fear of the ocean  guiding her, Rennie rushes to him, gripping and shaking  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you call for help?? Sean tries to get a grip and assess the situation, pacing frenetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. But we have to lower the  anchors so we don't drift any  further...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bow...front of the ship. There's a  hoist on each side that lowers them She starts to exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean for you to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just radio for help, okay??? She hurries out the door, working on terror-induced  adrenaline. Sean rushes to the radio console, depressing  the keying button, speaking into the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday, mayday, mayday...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as JULIUS arrives with the others from the locker room.  They react to the dead bodies while Sean continues at the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...can anybody out there hear  me?? No response. WAYNE and MILES rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, what's going on? Then he sees the corpses. He needs no further answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ... He's too scared to even videotape it. Sean is bombarded  with questions as he tries to figure out the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this, man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the radio even working??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there some international S.O.S.  thing you can do???

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly remembers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Channel 16...the distress frequency... (dialing knob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayday, mayday, mayday...this is the  Princess Ruby. Please, somebody  answer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a COAST GUARD CUTTER tracks through stormy seas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Coast Guard cutter Dallas.  What is the nature of your problem,  Ruby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they hear the voice, reacting, relieved and thrilled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain and Chief Engineer...  they've been...they're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a grave-pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your location?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your ship equipped with Omega  satellite navigation or LORAN?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LORAN has a digital printout of  your latitude and longitude. Give me  the coordinates and we'll be there as  quick as we can. Sean hurries to the LORAN, reading the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as LIGHTNING STRIKES above it in the night sky. Camera  slowly ADJUSTS to find the RADIO ANTENNA CABLE. A second  later, JASON'S HAND REACHES FOR IT, GETTING A FIRM GRASP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean hurries back to the radio, pressing it against  his spitless mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me the degrees first, followed by  minutes and sec... Suddenly his voice is CUT OFF, followed by STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Are you there?? No response. A lump sinks into everyone's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Jason drops the cable he's just torn out, marching  onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch bursts onto the bridge, followed by Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I demand to know what is going on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh dear God... She's seen the bodies. McCulloch follows her glance,  paling. He quickly takes charge, pushing through the  students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the radio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's...dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all going to die. All heads spin as the deranged DECK HAND treads out from  a shadowy corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the last ones. He's come back  for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The Deck Hand takes a final swig from his flask, dropping it with unsteady hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Voorhees. There is a collective, disconcerting silence triggered by the infamous name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane, old man. Jason Voorhees  has been dead for over thirty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks this ship, here and now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A killer walks this ship indeed. And  it's certainly none of us... The crazed old man gets his drift. Everyone looks at him  suspiciously. McCulloch grabs a SCALING KNIFE off the  wall, taking a step towards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one who's insane!! The raving man flees back the way he came. McCulloch  raises the flare gun; Miss Van Deusen grabs McCulloch's  arm, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That lunatic has been spouting off  about Jason since we boarded...  (eyeing bodies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
