dialogues.text: But that doesn't prove that he's the  one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking corpses are not real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well these dead bodies are sure  enough real. (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we regroup and find this  motherfucker before he finds us.  There's a murmur; it makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll do no.such thing and watch your  mouth, young man! I'm in charge here! They all look at McCulloch defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's out, McCulloch. (to the others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. Julius walks off the bridge; all the seniors follow  except Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please everybody, stay here!! They don't listen. McCulloch starts to go after  them...and then it hits him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ...where's Rennie??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's...she's dropping the anchors. I  thought the Coast Guard could find us  easier if...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?? You sent her out there with a  murderer running around loose??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie moves past wet, empty lounge chairs towards the bow. She passes a row of translucent windows. The first  three are normal...but the fourth has the SILHOUETTE OF

dialogues.speaker: JASON ON ITS OPPOSITE SIDE.
dialogues.text: He begins to stride parallel to her, then disappears  when the windows end and a wall takes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius and his followers continue on, passing Eva,  who's coming up from a staircase. She stops Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? I heard on the P.A.  system that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Captain's been murdered. The buzz  is that Jason might be on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason...Voorhees? She knows the legend as weld as everybody else. Wayne  nods gravely, moving to catch up with the others. Eva  rushes up to him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Tamara?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. And I'm not losing any sleep over  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she might be in trouble...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what else is new? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Eva, you're asking the wrong dude  to feel sorry for Tamara Mason. Wise  up -- it's not hip to be her friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care about being hip anymore. She means it. Wayne nods with understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but I've gotta find J.J. He hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie appears, fighting the wind and rain to get  closer to the anchor hoists.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH DECK WINDOW
dialogues.text: --spying on Rennie like a wolf watching a lamb. We MOVE a few windows down, getting a better view of her.

dialogues.speaker: ON JASON
dialogues.text: deciding that the time is right to strike. His hand moves to the bow entrance door knob, slowly turning it, pulling it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moving closer to the right anchor hoist, her back to us  as well as Jason. She climbs behind the hoist, looking at the consoles. Then suddenly a BARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby? She turns, catching a glimpse of her dog running down the side of the deck. Rennie leaves the hoist, going after  Toby.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: through the crack in the door, watching Rennie  unexpectedly take off. He's about to move after her when  ha hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara? Are you around here anywhere? Jason quietly closes the door. Rennie will have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: as she cautiously walks along, poking her head in every  alcove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara?

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: moving down the same corridor, catching a glimpse of Eva  before she turns a corner and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: (STEADICAM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eva steps into the hallway outside Tamara's stateroom.  She walks up to Tamara's door, knocking on it. It swings  open, unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamara? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk with you. She steps into Tamara's room and we go in with her. The  quarters are empty. Eva stands there for a beat, confused and scared. She's about to leave when a CREAKING SOUND  causes her to look back at:

dialogues.speaker: THE BATHROOM DOOR
dialogues.text: It slowly swings open...splashing Eva's eyes with  grotesque multi-images of Tamara: SHE IS HANGING ON THE

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: shrieks, running back out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and sliding to a abrupt halt because JASON IS STANDING AT THE END OF THE HALLWAY. He moves toward Eva like a  bulldozer. She turns a rapid 180 and sprints in retreat.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING WITH EVA, (HAND HELD)
dialogues.text: Gasping for oxygen, Eva has no time to even scream as she flees from the monster, erratically turning down a spiral staircase and running on.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW, (STEADICAM)
dialogues.text: chasing after her with the smooth determination of a  shark, never letting her get too far in the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty for a second, then Eva appears, weaving her way  through a maze of corridors and passageways. She races  past a sign directing passengers to "CLUB RUBY."

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: --entering the same corridor a beat after Eva exits it in the direction of the disco. He tramples onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The thudding low frequency of a mesmerizing dance tune  precedes Eva as she tears open a door, entering the  corridor. MOVE BACKWARDS WITH HER as she rushes forward,  curving through the shallow passageway and emptying out  onto a high tech DISCO FLOOR. A flashing Star Wars  lighting system assaults her all directions along with  the music. She's all alone in here.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON EVA
dialogues.text: The lights strobing across her face only accentuate her  terror. She spots another door on a small stage, rushing  to it. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE DOOR
dialogues.text: as Jason enters the corridor, SLAMMING THE DOOR SHUT  BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: decides this is the wrong place to be. She moves for the  corridor again and:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: appears on the corridor steps for a brief second. The  spotlight goes black, then flashes on again. Now he's  gone.

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: backs away, sliding along the edge of the dance floor  like she's on a building ledge. Chaser lights and mirror  balls fondle her body as she moves as far away from the  point where she last saw him. But:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: illuminates only ten feet from her, a crimson strobe  assaulting his hockey mask. She's on a collision course  with him.

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: whirls dizzily to the center of the dance floor upon the  sight of him. Camera SPINS with her in 360 degree arcs,  PUSHING IN on her face.

dialogues.speaker: EVA'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: spiraling counter-clockwise on the dance floor, flashes  of Jason materializing where she least expects to see  him. And getting closer. Finally at the point of  exhaustion:

dialogues.speaker: EVA
dialogues.text: stops, looking everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: EVA'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: He seems to be gone. She catches her breath...then  sensing his presence, she revolves a half-turn to face:

dialogues.speaker: THE HOCKEY MASK
dialogues.text: exploding under a pin spotlight, standing directly  before her. His forearms recoil with lightning speed as  he grips her throat...

dialogues.speaker: DISCO
dialogues.text: Thundering music. Frantic lights. And Jason and Eva at  the center of it all. HER FEET ARE TWENTY-FOUR INCHES OFF

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND, KICKING MADLY AS THE LIFE IS BEING CHOKED OUT
dialogues.text: OF HER. Finally Eva's legs go rag doll limp. Jason flings her to the ground like a sack of flour. This dance is  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie appears again, scanning her no-visibility  surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby? Where'd you go? No sign of her dog. She remembers her mission, heading to the anchors again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie arrives on the bow, climbing into the left  hoist box behind the huge anchor cable.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: moving up to the bow door like Jason did before, cracking it open, seeing Rennie from behind. And moving towards  her.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: is oblivious as she reads the directions above the  controls.

dialogues.speaker: HOIST LEVER, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as Rennie's hand grabs it, shoving it forward.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN HOIST BUTTON, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: A moment later, her thumb finds it and depresses it.

dialogues.speaker: ANCHOR CHAIN, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as the massive black chain links thunder to life.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: He's now within ten feet of the unaware girl.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: remains in the hoist box, making certain it is operating  correctly. A second later, we see the fleeting outline of a HUMAN SHAPE appear behind her.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Three feet from Rennie. She spins around to climb out of  the hoist box and GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's facing MCCULLOCH. He immediately reaches past her,  yanking the lever back to its center position, and:

dialogues.speaker: THE ANCHOR CHAIN, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: grinds to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as McCulloch faces her, angrily grabbing Rennie's arms,  shouting over the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had me worried to death!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Sean said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the one you should be listening  to! Do you think dropping an anchor in  the middle of a storm makes any sense  whatsoever? She tries to find some defense, but McCulloch leads her  off before any wards come forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a pair of SKEET RIFLES, three FIRE AXES, a FLARE GUN  and several POOL CUES are dumped onto the foam padded  plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Julius has gathered his small group of vigilantes,  including Miles and Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I managed to scrounge this shit from  the game room and hallways. Grab what  you want. Wayne takes one of the rifles; Miles grabs the axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you taking, Julius?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flexes fists)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're talking the possibility of Jason  Voorhees here. Julius pauses. He's not stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothin' but this gun. He reaches down, picking up the other rifle. And they  move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch guides his niece down the hallway, swinging  her door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we at least talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I refuse to discuss this ridiculous  notion that a ghoul is terrorizing  this ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the drowning boy I've  been seeing? He avoids eye contact. McCulloch takes her hand, ushering her across the threshold. She's standing inside her room  now; he's in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you've been...imagining...  has nothing to do with Jason Voorhees. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be safe, Rennie. That's  all I care about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not staying in my room, Uncle  Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't a request. He closes the door on her face, pulling out a key,  locking the dead bolt. She pounds on it from the other  side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Charles! He ignores her, briskly walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she throws her fists against the door a final time,  realizing it's futile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steam continues to seep from the maze of criss-crossing  pipes. Wayne appears on one of the catwalks. He's holding the skeet rifle under one arm, using the sun gun off his  video camera to guide him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J.J. -- you down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Wayne carefully lets his light guide him down the  precarious walkway. An unexpected blast of steam scares  the crap out of him, causing him to stumble.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S GLASSES, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: --They slip off the bridge of his nose, skittering down  through the catwalk and pipes to God knows where.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: lies helplessly on the metal grid work, realizing his  bleak predicament has just been squared. He pulls himself to a standing position again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a major problem, Wayne.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S BLURRY POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: His vision now gives him shadows and shapes rather than  crisp images. He raises the gun and continues unsteadily  forward.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH GRID WORK
dialogues.text: as Wayne inches forward. Camera slowly PANS INTO A  PROFILE OF JASON, watching him from a catbird seat.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: takes another step, almost tripping on a set of stairs  leading down to the next level. And when he arrives  there...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: instantly raises the rifle and FIRES...

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S BLURRY POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: ...and the body goes down. He's hit him!

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: stands there, breathing some relief. He gets an idea,  looking through his camcorder eyepiece. Wayne begins to  adjust the eyepiece diaptor. WAYNE'S POINT OF VIEW (B & W/VIEWFINDER MATTE) as the figure on the ground slips in and out of focus,  finally becoming crisp. WAYNE HAS SHOT A CREW MEMBER --  the same good looking one Tamara and Eva ogled earlier.  He's holding a screwdriver from his waist band tool set,  not a knife.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: slowly lowers his camera as his heart rises into his  throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... He raises his camcorder again, hoping a second view will  reveal a dead Jason rather than this young man. WAYNE'S POINT OF VIEW (B & W/VIEWFINDER MATTE) He gets half his wish: a HOCKEY MASK NOW FILLS HIS  FRAME...but Jason is far from dead. Wayne catches a split second glimpse of Jason's fist coming towards him, then  the camera is KNOCKED FROM HIS EYE AND THE WORLD BECOMES  DARK AND BLURRY.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE
dialogues.text: screams, blindly running as fast as he can. He trips,  picking himself up, stumbling down the catwalk stairs.  Wayne makes it about ten feet before he stumbles over  something, bringing with it a harsh strum from an  ELECTRIC GUITAR.

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S FEET
dialogues.text: Sure enough, his left shoe is resting on the pickups of a blood-streaked Gibson Flying V.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON WAYNE
dialogues.text: --sprawled out on the metal floor. He gropes around, his  hands feeling something. It sends chills from his groin  up through his scalp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne's hands are touching J.J.'S BLOODY FACE, A LARGE  CRACK IN HER SKULL. He doesn't have time to scream or cry because

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: hoists him off of J.J.'s body and flings him into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: which shorts out with a fanfare of ELECTRICAL SPARKS  AND FIRE, INSTANTLY FRYING WAYNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the overhead lights briefly flicker, then resume  normal operation. Sean stands opposite the navigational  chart, ping-ponging between it and the ship's  computers as Miss Van Deusen paces nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very worried)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to panic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens if we don't get control  of the ship, Sean? I want you to tell  me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could hit a reef, collide with  another ship...we could be out here  for weeks before anybody spotted us. They are suddenly jolted with a DOOR SLAM as McCulloch  storms onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find Rennie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's locked safe in her room, no  thanks to either of you. (like Sean isn't even in the  room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he brought it back on course yet? Sean doesn't look at him, still trying to assimilate the  wall of components.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's doing the best he can, Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the son of the Captain, for  Chrissakes. You'd think he'd be able  to operate this thing! Sean closes his eyes, trying to keep from losing his mind and temper. A fierce WAVE slaps the windows in front of  Sean's face, motivating him to get his shit together. He  checks the Omega and LORAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Sean doesn't answer, moving to the seat behind the helm.  His father's seat. Sean takes the chair, adjusting the  wheel, watching the compass. He studies a series of  buttons on the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN across them, stopping on one labeled "FIRE ALARM - DO NOT BREAK EXCEPT IN CASE OF EMERGENCY." Camera  continues around to find we are in the POWER ROOM, NOT on the bridge. Our vision suddenly lands on JASON, staring  at the alarm button, considering. He glances back over  his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW, (EFX)
dialogues.text: Wayne's body is NOW ON FIRE...AND THE BLAZE IS SPREADING  THROUGH THE ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean makes up his mind, flipping several toggle  switches.

dialogues.speaker: AUTO PILOT COMPUTER
dialogues.text: as Sean flips the last toggle and a green light  illuminates, indicating the AUTO PILOT is in effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked...we're back on course! Sean feels his confidence instantly rejuvenated. Miss Van Deuten immediately embraces him. But a fraction of time  later:

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON FIRE ALARM BUTTON
dialogues.text: Jason's fist SMASHES the alarm button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a LOUD SIREN cries out across the entire vessel.  The blood drains from Sean's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire alarm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the shrieking alarm assaults the main deck, hallways  and corridors, giving Julius, Miles and Wayne deep  pause for thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the alarm bombards Rennie's ears like everybody  else's. She hurries to her curtained porthole window,  working up the energy to look outside. Rennie gets a grip on them, FLINGING THEM OPEN. The DECK HAND'S CRAZED FACE  IS GAZING BACK AT HER. Rennie screams; a second later he  hurries off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch tears open a cabinet door labeled EMERGENCY  FLARE GUN. The siren continues to blast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shut that damn thing off?? Sean moves to a bank of switches, his eyes darting around for the appropriate switch. Miss Van Deusen sees  McCulloch remove the FLARE GUN from the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We already thought of that -- nobody  could possibly see it in this storm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one person who needs to  see it. And I'm going to find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the fire??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I doubt very much that one even  exists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use some common sense! Setting off a  fire alarm causes panic...the same  kind of panic caused by suggesting  Jason Voorhees is on board. (resolved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough is enough.  He marches out the door. Sean finds the alarm kill  switch, flipping it. The excruciating siren vanishes. He  grabs a pair of rain jackets, tossing one to Miss Van  Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get everybody together just  in case the fire's for real. Sean heads for the door, shoving it forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it slams open...and JULIUS steps out, not Sean, from a different deck door. TRACK with him as he treads along  the side of the ship, skeet rifle raised.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: walking past the lifeboat stations, the wind and  precipitation battering the small boats. With no warning, AN OBSCURE FIGURE LEAPS OUT, GRIPPING AN AXE.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: shoves the gun stock into his shoulder and takes  instantaneous aim...but he doesn't shoot. He slowly  lowers the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as MILES lowers the axe. They've just scared the shit out of each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take the upper deck. Julius nods. They separate. Neither boy notices the  smoke which is starting to emerge from a deck vent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filled with black smoke. The fire is spreading  dangerously close to a series of hoses attached to a fuel pump, leading to tanks below. A sign over them reads:  DANGER - FUEL TANKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --steaming and far from calm as the weather blitzes it.  Miles appears, climbing a ladder to the upper deck level.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW THROUGH LADDER
dialogues.text: Someone is spying on Miles from below, watching his every step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miles arrives, axe raised. He pauses to regard his  surroundings, then moves on. RACK FOCUS TO FIND JASON  RIGHT BEHIND HIM, having followed Miles up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only darkness and rain for a beat, then Miles  materializes, curving around the gargantuan smokestack.  He passes us and we SWING AROUND, now looking at the back of his head. He takes three more steps and JASON STEPS  INTO THE FOREGROUND. Miles senses his presence and JERKS

dialogues.speaker: HEAD...
dialogues.text: ...but Jason easily grabs the axe handle before it makes  contact, flinging it away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's pacing along when a clattering noise from above  makes him stop. Suddenly MILES' AXE THUDS INTO THE  MAHOGANY DECK NEXT TO HIS FOOT. Julius gazes at it,  jerking his head upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miles?? His answer is a LOUD CRACK OF LIGHTNING. At the same  time:

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING WITH MILES
dialogues.text: He's scrambling as fast as he can across the slippery  deck as the monster relentlessly pursues him.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: He's having no problem catching up to the defenseless  teenager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius zooms up them to aid his comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miles slides up to the mast and begins scaling it. He  glances downward and sees:

dialogues.speaker: MILES' POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Jason is right at his heels.

dialogues.speaker: MILES
dialogues.text: slips on a rung, regains control, and continues upward.  He makes it three more steps, almost at the uppermost  point when JASON GRABS THE BACK OF HIS COAT, TEARING HIM  OFF THE MAST.

dialogues.speaker: STUNT FREEFALL
dialogues.text: Miles cries out as he FREEFALLS BACKWARDS, somersaulting  and twisting like he's doing one of his better dives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Empty space for a half-second, then MILES' FACE JOLTS  INTO FRAME with a look of ultimate agony. Something has  abruptly stopped his fall. Something quite fatal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: coming around a corner, stopping dead in his tracks, his  stomach wrenching as his eyes fall on:

dialogues.speaker: MILES, (EFX)
dialogues.text: ...who is staring right back at him with dead pupils.  MILES HAS BEEN HORRIBLY IMPALED OM A SHIP FLAGPOLE.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: doesn't get the chance to grasp the reality of it because

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S HAND GRIPS HIS SHOULDER, SPINS HIM AROUND AND
dialogues.text: SLUGS HIM SQUARELY IN THE FACE. The force of it sends the boxer REELING BACKWARDS OFF THE RAILING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and Julius SPLASHES INTO THE ROUGH SEA. He's quickly  swallowed by the torrential waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie's HAND jiggles her doorknob again, confirming  that it's locked tight. RISE to find her desperate face;  she begins furiously pacing and we DOLLY BEHIND HER  ...but Rennie stops cold upon hearing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp....me.... Rennie whirls into a CLOSE UP, staring with disbelief at:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG JASON, (EFX)
dialogues.text: ...who is standing on the oval rug in her stateroom, his  hands reaching out to her. But then comes the  inexplicable: THE OVAL RUG TURNS INTO LAKE WATER AND  JASON SINKS INTO IT. He's drowning in the middle of her  room, choking on murky water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp me....I'm drowning...

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: stands frozen, feeling herself drawn to him like a  magnet. She crawls to the edge of her rug, which is now a deep lake, and extends her arms to him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG JASON
dialogues.text: grabs her hand, pulling hard, then grinning wide.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: feels the skin on her face crawling off her skull, her  eyes expanding because she's now looking at:

dialogues.speaker: HERSELF
dialogues.text: Rennie is holding onto herself, about four years younger  in a bathing suit, drowning in the lake. YOUNG RENNIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp....me....

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: screams with guttural fear, letting go of herself,  watching her younger self drown in the hole in her room.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
dialogues.text: disappears under the surface of the water...which seconds later CHANGES BACK INTO HER OVAL RUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie moves away, tears rolling down her face,  utterly confused. She backs against the wall next to her  porthole window and THE REAL JASON'S FIST SMASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW, GRABBING HER THROAT. Rennie struggles,  gasping for air as he attempts to strangle her.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: groping for a weapon to stop him, her fingers skittering  across her table like a spider.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE AND JASON
dialogues.text: Her head is pulled taut against the wall just below the  porthole, with Jason's hideous mask framed in the  circular shattered window. She's slowly dying.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S HAND
dialogues.text: Her movements slow as the oxygen leaves her system. But  Rennie's fingers miraculously find a recognizable object: the ink-dip pen given to her by Miss Van Deusen. She  seizes it, getting a firm grip.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: as Rennie JABS THE PEN BACKWARDS, SENDING THE SHARP  INSTRUMENT THROUGH THE EYEHOLE OF HIS MASK. Jason  instantly releases her, reeling backwards.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: sinks to the floor, scrambling on all fours to get as far away from the porthole as possible. She makes it across  the room to her stateroom door just as:

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: is SLAMMED OPEN FROM THE OTHER SIDE. She shrieks in  terror but it's SEAN who is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie...??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The window... Sean rushes to the shattered porthole, looking out,  seeing nothing. He steps back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what is happening  to me... She breaks down; he holds her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but Sean couldn't be more wrong. The flames are  lapping at the fuel pump and hoses, furiously burning  down into the tank. A second later the whole thing  EXPLODES IN A BALL OF FIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a huge HOLE is blown through the thick steel hull:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship noticeably rocks from the explosion. Rennie  clings to him fearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?? One second later, the lights begin to flicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as huge amounts of water rush in from a gaping hole in  the hull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the overhead lights flicker over McCulloch. There's  some fear mixed with the anger as he grips his flare gun, moving onward.

dialogues.speaker: PONT OF VIEW FROM KITCHEN OVENS
dialogues.text: Someone is crouched behind a massive convection oven,  spying on McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLOCH
dialogues.text: almost flinches when the lights die and he's plunged  into blackness. He moves forward, every step tentative.  He passes the convection ovens and we REMAIN on them,  spotting the frightened face of the DECK HAND in the  shadows. The deranged old man is very sober now,  clutching a LARGE KITCHEN KNIFE for defense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean paces feverishly in the blackness of her room,  trying to think, talking to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rule one, don't panic. Rule two,  assess the damage and act  accordingly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the ship going to sink?? He returns to Rennie, the panic settling back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Her ultimate fear is staring her straight in the face.  Suddenly the dim blue lights flicker on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The emergency lights just kicked in... Sean makes Rennie look into his eyes. His words are meant to convince himself as much as Rennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be okay. I want you to wait by  the lifeboats, just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going near any lifeboat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rennie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miss Van Deusen gathers a handful of students who are  panicking, sitting them down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody wait right here until I come  back with the others -- understand? They nod, frightened to death. She dashes away, carrying  us into a view of the dining room windows. No one  notices the SILHOUETTE OF JASON passing by on the outside desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea water is pouring into the ship's motors. Clouds of  steam and black smoke fill the room as the engine  bearings begin to GRIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch rushes up to Rennie's already open door,  cautiously entering with flare gun raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie??

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLOCH'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: The room is empty, shards of the porthole glass scattered across her rug. He steps over to it, bringing his head up to the gaping hole, peering outside. We wait for his  attack...but it doesn't come. McCulloch's eyes take us to something across the room. The bathroom door is afar.

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLOCH
dialogues.text: cautiously steps up to the door, silently grabbing the  knob and SWINGING IT OPEN. It's empty. He hears  something, spinning around. Again, nothing is there.  McCulloch quickly moves to the telephone and dials. A few seconds pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, answer!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on the bridge telephone, ringing repeatedly. RISE  TO FIND JASON, ignoring the phone, scrutinizing the deck  below through rain-streaked windows.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Miss Van Deusen is darting across the deck, gathering up  a trio of terrified seniors.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: Jason methodically moves to the bank of switches,  studying them.

dialogues.speaker: CONSOLE
dialogues.text: In large, unmistakable letters over a red button are the  words "ABANDON SHIP ALARM." He flips back the plastic  safety cover, exposing the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible grinding sound echoes through the narrow  corridor. Sean and Rennie appear at the opposite end,  coughing on the black smoke which clouds their  passageway. Sean looks down, seeing that they are  standing in a puddle of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water has gotten to the engines. (coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get everybody off this  ship...

dialogues.speaker: ABANDON SHIP BUTTON
dialogues.text: as Jason presses it with firm deliberation, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WHOOPING SIREN blasts through the passageway. Sean and  Rennie have no time to react because:

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR, (EFX)
dialogues.text: A sealed compartment door EXPLODES OPEN WITH THE PRESSURE OF SEA WATER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a WALL OF WATER ENGULFS.RENNIE AND SEAN, KNOCKING  THEM DOWN. Sean fights to pull her up, but not in time  for her to witness:

dialogues.speaker: WAYNE'S CHARRED CORPSE, (EFX)
dialogues.text: which bobs up in front of her. Rennie cries out,  scrambling to grab onto Sean as what's left of Wayne's  body washes past them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a door opens and Miss Van Deusen guides a half-dozen  SENIORS over to the LIFEBOAT STATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over storm)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody climb in! They follow her orders as the Abandon Ship alarm wretches on. But little do they know that:

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Someone is briskly moving towards the group and Miss Van  Deusen. Just as we are within a few feet of her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --It's MCCULLOCH who's approached them. He grabs Miss Van Deusen, shaking her violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do with Rennie??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! I went to her cabin and... McCulloch rushes off before she can finish. Miss Van  Deusen turns back to the other kids, helping them into  the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody hurry...please...

dialogues.speaker: MAHOGANY DECKING
dialogues.text: We slowly DOLLY BACKWARDS until Miles' AXE comes into  frame, still stuck in the mahogany decking. A beat, then  JASON'S HALAL DISLODGES IT FROM THE WOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean climbs up from below, soaked to the bone, pulling up a half-conscious Rennie. Sean carries her around a  corner, where he collides with McCulloch. McCulloch  pulls Rennie away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never should've set foot on this  ship. This is your fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jason's fault!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not another word, do you hear me??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miss Van Deusen throws the "down" lever and the  lifeboat hoist begins to lower the boat. Camera SLOWLY

dialogues.speaker: LIFEBOAT
dialogues.text: One of the students screams, the others clinging together upon the sight of this infamous monster. But the boat is  already over the edge, past the point of return. And  lowering at a snail's pace.

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
dialogues.text: turns to see JASON APPROACHING THEM WITH AXE RAISED. She  backs away but Jason ignores her, heading directly for  the hoist. He arches back with his weapon and SLICES  DOWNWARD.

dialogues.speaker: HOIST CABLE, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as Jason's axe CHOPS THE CABLE IN TWO, and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bow cable SNAPS, DUMPING THE HALF DOZEN TEENAGERS  INTO THE TURBULENT SALT WATER. They last about five  seconds before succumbing to a drowning death.

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN
dialogues.text: sees it all, her intestines constricting in agonizing  knots. She summons all her rationale and sends it down to her legs, running away as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: MISS VAN DEUSEN'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: --knocking down deck tables, chairs and chaise lounges as she flees. The creative writing teacher swerves around a  column, heading for an interior door, sliding to a stop  as it BANGS OPEN IN FRONT OF HER. McCulloch steps  outside, carrying Rennie, with Sean right behind her.  Rennie is conscious now, squirming free of her uncle upon the sight of Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: INCLUDE ALL
dialogues.text: as Rennie rushes into Miss Van Deusen's arms. The teacher holds her, beginning to cry herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you with the others,  woman?? Finally the message comes forth:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason...he has an axe... His face grows taut with anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Voorhees is dead!! A PRIMAL SCREAM OF AGONY immediately cries out behind  them, the words unintelligible. They turn around to  witness THE DECK HANG STAGGERING TOWARDS THEM, GRIPPING

dialogues.speaker: MCCULLOCH
dialogues.text: raises the flare gun with zero hesitation and FIRES IT...

dialogues.speaker: DECK HAND, (EFX)
dialogues.text: ...and the charge EXPLODES INTO HIS CHEST. He stands  there with his chest smoldering, almost like a gargoyle  in effigy. A second later the poor old man falls forward, and:

dialogues.speaker: HIS BACK, (EFX)
dialogues.text: They all see that JASON'S AXE HAS BEEN BURIED IN HIS  BACK.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO MASTER
dialogues.text: McCulloch gazes with utter disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get off this ship!! They back away from the horrid sight and begin to run,  the Abandon Ship alarm still attacking their ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as McCulloch, Miss Van Deusen, Rennie and Sean scramble  to the closest lifeboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody in -- I'll get the hoists McCulloch has no time for politeness, moving to the  lifeboat ahead of the women. Rennie stops cold, gazing  classy-eyed at the small boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, sweetheart -- get in... But she doesn't budge. McCulloch levels wild eyes on her, quickly climbing back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the boat, Rennie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can and you will!! He tries to slap her out of it, dragging her over to the  boat, ignoring her terror-stricken frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone, Charles! Miss Van Deusen quickly moves to a hysterical Rennie and  holds her, eyeing McCulloch vehemently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as rain begins to wash the blood from his back. JASON'S  FOOT TRUDGES INTO FRAME...then his HAND REACHES DOWN,  RETRIEVING HIS AXE FROM THE DECK HAND'S SPINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie clings to         Miss Van Deusen, crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only way, Rennie. Let's get  in the boat now, okay? Please...for  me? Rennie finds herself nodding. Miss Van Deusen helps the  trembling girl up the steps, an angered McCulloch right  behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie climbs over the boat edge, RECOILING AT THE  SOUND OF A SNARLING DOG. Toby is curled up in the  corner of the lifeboat, teeth bared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby... She climbs in, moving to her equally, relieved dog,  McCulloch and Miss Van Deusen right behind her.

dialogues.speaker: HOIST BUTTON, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as Sean jabs it and the hoist motor kicks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just as a huge BOLT OF LIGHTNING cracks over the smoke  stack and upper deck. JASON steps out from behind it,  gaping down on them with frightening omnipresence.  Gripping the bloody axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean climbs in the boat as it continues to lower. He  takes one look back at the ship and sees:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: rapidly moving down the staircase towards them. Sean's  view is CUT OFF as the lifeboat sinks below deck level.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as Sean's eyes dart around, down to the sea, up at the  hoist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...faster....

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: trampling towards the hoist, about thirty feet away now.  The boat has already disappeared over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the lifeboat continues to lower, about ten feet from  making contact with the tumultuous ocean. The ship's hull is crooked and sinking.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: as he relentlessly moves to the hoist cable, raising his  axe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the ship finally touches water, and:

dialogues.speaker: HOIST CABLE
dialogues.text: Jason's axe blade CHOPS THE CABLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the hoist cable falls limply over them. Jason's  too late. Sean looks up and sees:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: standing by the hoist, hovering over the edge. Very  angry.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, (TANK)
dialogues.text: grabs an oar, turning back to McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start rowing!! McCulloch takes the oar as Miss Van Deusen holds onto  Rennie tightly, the girl's eyes squeezed shut. Sean looks up at the ship again, and:

dialogues.speaker: SEAN'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Jason is none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean looks around with confusion as huge waves, wind and  rain pummel them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone...

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW FROM WATER, (TANK)
dialogues.text: ...or is he? We're moving towards the lifeboat at water  level, almost like a shark preparing for attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean breathes with some relief, resuming his rowing with  McCulloch. They get about three strokes apiece before:

dialogues.speaker: A DARK FIGURE, (TANK)
dialogues.text: lunges from under the ocean surface, grabbing onto  Sean. Everybody SCREAMS...but it's JULIUS, gasping for  oxygen, spitting up seawater. Sean pulls him over the  edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Julius! Miss Van Deusen moves to help him and we:

dialogues.speaker: DAY, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: The ship is gone now, the lifeboat a speck in the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water is less rough now, the rain replaced with fog.  Julius has taken McCulloch's place behind an oar;  McCulloch is flanking his shivering niece with Miss Van  Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (miserable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't find the shore soon we're  all going to die. Sean tries to ignore him, keeping his mind on rowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unable to hide fear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where we are, Sean? Sean pauses, utterly exhausted. He thinks for a moment,  remembering his father's gift. Sean reaches into his coat pocket, removing the pocket navigational calculator. He  stares at it long and hard. Julius looks over at him,  seeing that Sean is on the verge of tears. He grips his  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, if I can make it, so can.  you. Sean slowly nods, turning on the calculator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the lifeboat rows into frame, the water relatively  calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McCulloch, Rennie and Miss Van Deusen are asleep, Sean  and Julius rowing on sheer will power. Sean takes one  more stroke, feels himself passing out, then regains his  coherence again. Julius glances off the side of the ship  for no particular reason, then does a doubletake.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW, (SECOND UNIT - N.Y.)
dialogues.text: They are rowing right past THE STATUE OF LIBERTY,  illuminated in all its glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius feels his eyes widening and a huge smile taking  control of his haggard face. He tugs on Sean's sleeve,  his eyes never leaving the monument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, wake up! Check it out!! The other stir as well, opening their eyes, not sure if  it's some kind of vision or if they are genuinely here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God damn, we're in New York! You did  it, my man!! Julius howls with delight, Miss Van Deusen hugging Rennie as Julius gives Sean the high-five. Toby barks.

dialogues.speaker: NEW YORK HARBOR
dialogues.text: as the lifeboat rows toward the very famous skyline of  Manhattan, twinkling in the near distance. We can hear  the faint sound of Julius singing "New York, New York,"  relieved to be alive. They're going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the sound of Julius' voice grows fainter. The water  begins to ripple...then the top half of a HOCKEY MASK

dialogues.speaker: BREAKS THE SURFACE FOR A BREATH OF AIR, SINKING AGAIN.
dialogues.text: And swimming onward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius and Sean row the lifeboat up to a narrow barge  beneath deserted dock warehouses. They are not in the  safest part of town by a longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they climb onto the barge. Rennie breathes with relief as she steps off the boat. She takes a final glance back  at it and sees:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RENNIE
dialogues.text: flailing her arms in the water right next to the  lifeboat, drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp...me.... Suddenly a DECOMPOSED HAND REACHES UP FROM BELOW,  GRABBING HER, DRAGGING HER UNDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes in utter shock, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! They all follow her eyeline...but the water is calm,  nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay...you're safe now... McCulloch grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on -- everybody up the ladder. He's the first one up. Sean looks at Rennie, concerned,  then hoists Toby up in his arms. They all begin climbing  the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: LADDER
dialogues.text: as the last pair of feet disappear over the top edge of  the dock. Camera PANS back down the rungs, finding the  lifeboat and barge again. Suddenly JASON SPRINGS FROM THE WATER, CLIMBING ONTO THE BARGE. He gazes up at his new  surroundings, quite different from all the years he's  spent at Crystal Lake. But an item at the far end of the  dock causes him the longest pause...

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: A tattered billboard over one of the warehouses  advertises the NEW YORK RANGERS HOCKEY TEAM, featuring a  full shot of the HOCKEY-MASKED GOALIE.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: looks at it long and hard. He tears off his life  preserver wits renewed ambition.

dialogues.speaker: BARGE AND DOCK WAREHOUSES
dialogues.text: as Jason heads up the ladder. He's about to take  Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as our survivors head into an isolated, foreboding group  of dock warehouses and alleys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must be a phone around here  somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wonderful choice of places to dock a  boat, Mr. Robertson. Sean looks away, trying to keep from losing his temper.

dialogues.speaker: PREDATOR'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: We're spying on them from behind a stack of crates as  they come in our direction. Waiting for the right moment.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: as they move towards the stack of crates. Without  warning, a PAIR OF GANG BANGERS JUMP OUT, BOTH HOLDING  GUNS. Nervous young druggies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it!! All hands go up. Gang Banger #2 grabs McCulloch's watch  and wallet, skimming through a wad of bills and credit  cards while #1 keeps them covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some good shit here, holmes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyeing Rennie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right... He steps over to Rennie, brushing her hair back with the  barrel of his revolver, spotting the Statue of Liberty  pendant Sean gave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now ain't that sweet. He tears it off her neck, pocketing it. Sean angrily  moves toward him and Gang Banger #l shoves the barrel  against Rennie's temple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, superman. Be a hero. Sean has no choice but to freeze. Julius flexes his  fists, but he too has Gang Banger #2's gun leveled on  him. McCulloch stares at the thugs with obvious contempt. It doesn't go unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem, Dad? McCulloch offers some rare silence, shaking a "no" to the gun-toting kid. Rennie's dog-begins to growl, backing  away, ready to defend her. Gang Banger #1 points his  barrel at Toby with zero conscience, cocking back the  hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! She pushes his arm to the side just as the bullet  FIRES...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: as the bullet tears up asphalt next to the dog's paws.  Toby sprints off into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: Gang Banger #1 grabs Rennie by the hair, brutally jerking her head back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't hurt her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurt this princess? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I do that? They cough out laughs. Gang Banger #1 looks into Rennie's eyes, his barrel still on her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like a party girl, princess.  How'd you like to go on a date with me  and my friend? If you're free, that  is. More phlegm-filled laughs. He drags her away, Gang Banger #2 backing away with him with his gun still trained on  the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You follow and we'll blow her fuckin'  head off, comprende? The others watch helplessly as Rennie is abducted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't let those gang-bangers get  away, man... Julius starts to move after them. McCulloch grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard him! We have to call the  police Julius jerks away from McCulloch's grasp. But he knows  McCulloch        is right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone split up -- we'll cover more  ground that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's such a safe idea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My niece's life hangs in the balance  right now!! Every second counts. No more rebuttal. They hurry off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a narrow passageway between warehouses...decrepit  brownstones with shattered chicken-wire windows, moss  growing on the bricks. The Gang Bangers appear with  Rennie, dragging her down some concrete steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the casbah, princess. PAN AROUND with them as they walk through a thick blanket of STEAM which pours out of a factory vent. We MOVE  through the mist with them, revealing a tattered, rain- soaked couch and chair, upholstery shredded. A spool once used for telephone wire functions as their coffee table.  They splash through puddles, throwing her down on the  couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --looking back at the steam vent. JASON APPEARS IN THE  BILLOWING MIST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as a yellowish liquid squirts out the dirty needle. WIDEN to find Gang Banger #2 holding it with transfixed eyes,  his compadre holding a squirming Rennie down on the  couch, tearing back her jacket to reveal a bare arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loosen up, baby. It'll feel way better if you're stoned.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S FEET
dialogues.text: Amongst the slime and cigarette butts is a discarded  syringe. Jason picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just as Gang Banger #2 jabs Rennie with the needle.  Gang Banger #1 wrestles off his torn leather jacket,  pushing Rennie back on the exposed foam padding as his  friend watches excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slang us some more 'caine, JoJo. We're  in for a long night. Gang Banger #2 runs out the back way. #1 tears open  Rennie's blouse, his filthy mouth moving to her neck.  Rennie spits in his face. He hesitates not in SLAPPING  HER HARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your parade, princess. Can be  smooth or can be rough. Your choice. She closes .her eyes, trying to blot out what's about to  happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm in love. PUSH IN on his face as his neck arches down, bringing his lips toward her chest. Just before contact he GRUNTS  THICKLY, HIS EYES BUGGING OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason is standing right behind him, shoving something  into his back, out of frame. He thrusts it again,  bringing with it one more horrific grunt from the kid.  Jason goes for number three and:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's syringe gets shoved completely through him, the  needle sticking out his front side.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: opens her eyes, looking into the dead boy's face as  blood drips from his mouth. He collapses in front of  her, giving way to a view of JASON TOWERING OVER HER. At  the same time:

dialogues.speaker: GANG BANGER
dialogues.text: comes around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgot my money, holmes... Ha stops dead in his tracks at the sight of Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you? Jason paces toward him. The kid glances at his dead  friend arched over the couch, quickly whipping out his  .38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead, fuckhead.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: ...but Jason keeps on coming. Five shots later and  Jason's still standing, easily picking up the slime ball  and SHOVING HIM HEAD FIRST INTO THE MOSSY BRICK WALL. The kid falls in a bloody heap.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: shoves Gang Banger #1 off of her as Jason returns his  attention to her. She grabs a loose brick and FLINGS IT  AT HIM, CRACKING HIS HOCKEY MASK, momentarily  disorienting him. Rennie sprints away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius runs into view, looking down a menacing alley,  spotting a phone booth. He hurries for it.

dialogues.speaker: PREDATOR'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Like a cat watching a bird, we watch Julius head for the  booth.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: slams open the booth door, grabbing the receiver,  punching the "operator" digit. SLOWLY PUSH IN on him as  he waits for an answer. Several more rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Finally a click and muffled words from the operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the police -- this is an  emergency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH! as JASON'S FIST CRASHES THROUGH THE BOOTH WINDOW,  GRABBING JULIUS BY THE THROAT. Julius grips Jason's scaly arm with all his strength, staring at the cracked hockey  mask framed in the shattered window. Julius summons all  his strength, tearing free of Jason's grasp and running  out the door. The phone is left dangling.

dialogues.speaker: RUNNING WITH JULIUS, (HAND HELD)
dialogues.text: with no apparent direction. Literally running for his  life.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: He's just as quick, but smoother and more methodical.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW, (HAND HELD)
dialogues.text: heading up the alley, spotting a fire escape, diverting  his course straight for it.

dialogues.speaker: FIRE ESCAPE
dialogues.text: as Julius LEAPS ONTO IT, dragging himself up, climbing as fast as is humanly possible.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: ...but Jason is-far from human, easily negotiating the  wrought-iron stairs and rapidly catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius' head appears, clawing his way onto the tar- papered surface, running to the opposite side. A second  later, JASON HOPS UP RIGHT BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius soon learns the awful truth that the only way  up is the only way down...with the exception of a head- splitting freefall. No way is he gonna jump. Julius turns back to Jason, raising his fists, psyching himself up for the fight of his life. He whispers to himself:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use the combos and keep the feet  light... THE FIGHT BEGINS, man against monster, each sizing the  other up.  Jason takes the first swing, Julius deftly dodging him  and countering with left-right-left combination. They  have absolutely no effect. Julius follows up with a round of kidney punches. Again, nothing. Julius finds himself  being forced back against the rings, which in this case  is the edge of the roof. He risks a glance backwards and  sees:

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS' POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: It's a long, rough way down. It's do or die time.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SCENE
dialogues.text: as Julius SLAMS PUNCH AFTER PUNCH INTO JASON, forcing him back to the center of the rooftop, spending every last  ounce of his energy in doing so. He throws one more  feeble punch, knowing it's his last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your best shot, motherfucker... Jason gladly obliges, winding up and recoiling with a  punch none of us expected...

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS' HEAD, (EFX)
dialogues.text: gets literally knocked off his shoulders, cascading off  the edge of the rooftop, and:

dialogues.speaker: SLANTED LOWER ROOF
dialogues.text: --the decapitated head lands on a sloped roof below,  rolling down towards street level and falling into a  garbage-filled dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie dizzily runs down the alley, the effects of the drugs kicking in.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (POST EFX)
dialogues.text: Blurry, disoriented, erratic. Suddenly A FIGURE JUMPS OUT FROM A CORRIDOR IN FRONT OF HER.

dialogues.speaker: RETURN TO SHOT
dialogues.text: It's SEAN. He rushes to her, sensing her disorientation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie...what'd they do to you??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drugs... (serious pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Jason came. He's here, Sean. Oh Jesus. He never expected this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find the others. Together they run off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Miss Van Deusen briskly walks below us, far from  relaxed in this threatening environment.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: She moves forward, the only sound being her shoes against wet asphalt. Four more steps, then a DARK, OUT OF FOCUS  FIGURE STEPS OUT BEHIND HER WITH A GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze. RACK FOCUS to find a uniformed IRISH COP standing there,  service revolver raised. McCulloch steps out from the  alcove as well, recognizing Miss Van Deusen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay -- she's with me. She turns around, lowering her hands, utterly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My apologies, Miss. My unit's right  over here. They head through an ABANDONED PARKING LOT towards a  concrete wall with stairs; about six feet above the wall  is an upper street, where his patrol car is parked. They  get halfway through the lot when they hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean and Rennie run to join them from the alley.  McCulloch rushes to his niece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie, thank God... But Rennie goes to Miss Van Deusen instead. It's a bitter pill for McCulloch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's here in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true, Rennie?? She nods, unable to repress her fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this the lass in question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stewing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is...Jason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a walking corpse, a phantasm from  hell. The others stare at McCulloch angrily. Miss Van Deusen  turns to the confused policeman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid you'll have some trouble  believing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So try me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: parked above the abandoned garage, the interior dark. The Cop and our heroes appear in the background, coming  towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right -- I find it a tall tale  indeed.  But you seem like honest folks so I'm  inclined to believe at least some of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. The first thing we' have to  do is find Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he'll pop up soon enough. Why  don't you climb in the back while I  radio for backup.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK DOOR AS HE SWINGS IT
dialogues.text: OPEN...but even in this darkness, we see that it's  empty. They climb in. The Cop opens his drivers door,  and...

dialogues.speaker: DOME LIGHT, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: The car dome light blinks on, and...

dialogues.speaker: BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Our four survivors' faces are brightly illuminated,  INSTANTLY CHANGING TO GASPS AND SCREAMS because:

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POINT OF VIEW, (EFX)
dialogues.text: Julius' severed head is resting on the dash board,  staring back at them!!!

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: reacting to their terror, seeing Julius' head, quickly  grabbing the radio mike. But he has no time for a message because JASON REACHES UP FROM THE PARKING LOT PIT BELOW,  GRABBING THE COP'S ANKLE, DRAGGING HIM DOWN. The radio is still in his grasp.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCH RADIO, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as the radio cord grows taut, finally snapping. The  Irish cop's awful yell echoes over it, silencing after a  sick THUD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The foursome instantly try to flee the car, but police  cars have no door handles in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There aren't any handles!! Cocaine flowing through her veins, Rennie acts  hyperkinetically, scratching her way over the seats just  as:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: appears at the parking lot stairs, STALKING STRAIGHT  TOWARDS THE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no time for escape. Rennie finds the ignition  and fires it up, jamming it into drive and STOMPING ON  THE ACCELERATOR. Julius' head rolls off the dash, onto  the floorboards.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (POST EFX)
dialogues.text: Her vision is still a stoned one but clear enough to set  her target. We come straight at the abominable creature  and:

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: Jason is mowed down.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: slams on the brakes, jerks it into reverse and FLOORS IT  AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (EFX)
dialogues.text: as the automobile grinds back over him a second time.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: stomps on the brake pedal and the tires SCREECH TO A  HALT. They all take a moment to catch their breath,  looking out the front window...

dialogues.speaker: THEIR POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Jason lies dead on the asphalt. For about two seconds. He SLOWLY STANDS.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: desperately throws it into forward again, gripping the  wheel and RACING FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)
dialogues.text: Jason's standing there for one second, but the next  moment he is LEAPING OUT OF THE WAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the squad car SMASHES THROUGH A CHAIN LINK FENCE,  FREEFALLING TO THE ABANDONED PARKING LOT BELOW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the car bottoms out, then swerves into a sharp right  turn, racing down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)
dialogues.text: as Jason appears at the end of the alley, blocking their  retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie stomps the brake pedal, jerking it into  reverse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as she backs up, changes gears and races down an  intersecting alley.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW FROM FRONT BUMPER, (STUNT DRIVE)
dialogues.text: speeding towards an escape when JASON POPS OUT AGAIN!  He's everywhere all at once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slamming on the discs one more time, flooring it into  reverse.

dialogues.speaker: TIRES
dialogues.text: as the squad car's rear tires smoke and spin, finally  gripping pavement.

dialogues.speaker: POINT OF VIEW OUT REAR WINDOW, (STUNT DRIVE)
dialogues.text: as we fly backwards...and JASON APPEARS BEHIND THEM!!

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: --Rennie's terrified face filling it, seeing that Jason  is in back of them.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON REAR TIRES, (SECOND UNIT)
dialogues.text: as they screech to a halt one final time, rapidly  rotating in the opposite direction and speeding out of  frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie is almost maniacal now, her knuckles white around  the vinyl wheel, her foot practically mashed through the  floorboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie, for God's sake slow down!! She doesn't hear him, or anything for that matter. Her  eyes remain straight ahead, never blinking.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (POST EFX)
dialogues.text: There's a FIGURE standing in the distance. But it looks  too small to be Jason. We RUSH TOWARDS IT, CHANGING INTO  SLOW MOTION JUST BEFORE IMPACT. The figure is a dripping  wet boy with a sinister smile. YOUNG JASON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the front of the squad car RAMS THE BRICK WALL HEAD- ON, THE HOOD BURSTING INTO FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the front passenger door is shoved open by Sean, who  drags out Rennie. McCulloch follows close behind, helping Sean carry her away from the wreckage, over by a row of  old oil drums filled with slime and rainwater. Then it  suddenly hits Sean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Van Deusen... He takes two steps back to the car when:

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The squad car interior is ENGULFED IN A BALL OF FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: opens her dazed eyes, seeing Miss Van Deusen's body  charring inside the wreckage. It's incomprehensible. She  numbly gets to her feet, stepping towards it. Something  makes her hesitate: she peers down at the asphalt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pool of gasoline has collected, flames dancing across  its glassy surface. Suddenly a TINY ROWBOAT DISSOLVES IN, not unlike the lifeboat she was so afraid of. The  rowboat glides across the surface of the burning  gasoline, TWO PEOPLE RIDING IN IT. The flames and asphalt SLOWLY FADE OUT AND GIVE WAY TO A SERENE LAKE.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Shimmering water, clouds and pine trees reflected in it.  The rowboat floats into view. The two occupants are YOUNG RENNIE and MCCULLOCH. She's wearing a bathing suit and an innocent smile. And not an inkling of fear about the  water. She stands, letting the sun soak into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect for a swim, isn't it? She frowns at him, looking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been coming out here every  summer for the last three years, young  lady, and you still haven't learned  how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take some lessons this time. I  promise. She bends over, splashing the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you said last year. I  think the time for your first swimming  lesson has just come. The splashing stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to end up drowning like  that Voorhees boy, do you? She's instantly tense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He never learned how either and he's  still at the bottom of this lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he is indeed. And ready to pull  down anybody who falls in and can't  swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I? Let's find out. ...And quicker than she's able to react to it, MCCULLOCH  PUSHES HER OVERBOARD.

dialogues.speaker: SPLASH
dialogues.text: as Rennie's body violently disrupts the calm surface.  She immediately begins to flounder. McCulloch calmly  leans over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better swim before Jason drags you  down, Rennie. Come on, you can do  it... ...but Rennie thrashes in the water, struggling to keep  from sinking under the surface.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Her uncle's face blurs and clears as water splashes her  eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I...I can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can and you will! Swim, Rennie!

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: is too panicked to obey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp...me.... She coughs on some water then disappears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world above her ceases to exist, murky lake water  taking over. Rennie looks-down, and to her horror...

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (TANK)
dialogues.text: Young Jason is grabbing her ankle and dragging her  down. The whole image BURSTS INTO FLAMES and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the gasoline continues to burn, the rowboat gone.  ADJUST to find RENNIE'S FACE, the flames of the car  wreckage flickering over her glassy eyes. She looks up at Miss Van Deusen's body one last time before:

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD CAR, (EFX)
dialogues.text: The auto's fuel tank EXPLODES, SHRAPNEL FLYING  EVERYWHERE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up at her uncle with knowing eyes. Eyes that  tell him she's remembered everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pushed me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensively)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only trying to teach you. But I  pulled you out, Rennie. I saved your  life. Rennie just stares, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You son of a bitch... She lets it build until she's ready to explode...then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was down there!!! And Rennie runs off. McCulloch starts to follow but Sean  grabs him, shoving him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep away from her! Sean chases after Rennie. Camera methodically PANS BACK  TO MCCULLOCH, crumpled on the ground. A very bitter man.  He wipes his hands, getting ready to stand when THE  SHADOW FALLS OVER HIM. His skin fades to porcelain white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You...are...NOT POSSIBLE. But possible, and actual, he is. A PAIR OF ROTTED ARMS  EXTEND DOWN, RIPPING HIM OUT OF FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: as the walking corpse lifts a screaming McCulloch over  his head, carrying him over to one of the scum-filled OIL DRUMS, SHOVING HIM HEAD-FIRST INTO IT. Jason grips  McCulloch's thrashing legs as bubbles rise to the surface of the slime, a pathetic gurgling reverberating out the  drum. At last McCulloch's appendages go limp. Jason  releases him, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean runs into view, glancing around, spotting Rennie, crouched against a crumbled brick wall. No tears...only  hate. Sean sits down next to her. After several  moments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was at school when they told me.  'Rennie, we have some very bad news...  your parents have been killed in an  auto accident.' Sean gently takes her hand, sharing her internal agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It seems like everybody I care about  ends up... She can't finish. PUSH IN as Sean kisses her on the  forehead, then makes her look into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not this time. He caresses her face; it develops into a tender kiss.  Finally she holds him back, letting it out. At the same  time:

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Somebody is creeping at a low angle towards them.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND RENNIE
dialogues.text: are lost in their shared quiet moment...until the  GROWLING SOUND becomes audible. They look up, seeing:

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: cautiously approaching them. Rennie stands, absolutely  relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toby... She starts to move towards him and her dog SNARLS  VICIOUSLY, CROUCHING BACK IN FEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, boy? Another protective growl, then:

dialogues.speaker: CRASH
dialogues.text: as Jason stampedes through a stack of crates and garbage  cans behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN, RENNIE AND TOBY
dialogues.text: abruptly flee down the alley, Jason in mad pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie, Sean and the dog run straight towards us,  Jason swiftly catching up. FAST TRACK WITH THEM over to a deserted, rain-slicked SUBWAY ENTRANCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they bang through the glass doors, sailing past us.  Three beats later, JASON APPEARS, not bothering to open  the door, STAMPEDING RIGHT THROUGH THE GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, Rennie and Toby sail down the escalators past a few scattered COMMUTERS. Again, Jason appears, looming tall  at the top. He starts down the "up" escalator.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW, (ICY.)
dialogues.text: as an ELDERLY COUPLE rises toward us. Their reactions  grow more bleak the closer we get, finally registering  terror as we plow right through them.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY TURNSTILES, (ICY.)
dialogues.text: Sean and Rennie hop over a metal turnstile, Toby crawling under it. A TICKET TAKER leans out his window, shouting  at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! The teenagers are soon forgotten as JASON SMASHES THROUGH

dialogues.speaker: THE TURNSTILE LIKE THE TERMINATOR, TEARING THE ALUMINUM
dialogues.text: WHEEL RIGHT OFF ITS BASE. The Ticket Taker reacts  speechlessly, deciding not to press his luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean and Rennie slide up to the edge of the track pit, SEEING THE LIGHTS OF AN APPROACHING TRAIN which is taking too long to get there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... ...but Jason arrives before the train. Toby barks and  snarls, trying to protect them. Jason is unfazed. He  treads toward them and:

dialogues.speaker: DOG TOBY
dialogues.text: leaps onto Jason, sinking his teeth into the monster's  throat. Jason wrestles the animal into submission just  as:

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBWAY TRAIN
dialogues.text: streaks into the station. A fraction of time later:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: heaves the dog in front of the train.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: shrieks in horror as Toby disappears inside the pit just  as the train roars by.

dialogues.speaker: ONLOOKERS
dialogues.text: They're New Yorkers, but not callous enough to stomach  this, quickly scattering. Even a group of severe  SKINHEADS decide they can wait for the next train,  quickly heading up the escalators after seeing Jason in  action.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN
