dialogues.text: makes Rennie look away, dragging her with him along the  platform edge in retreat as Jason returns his attention  to them. They reach the end of the platform, having no  choice but to board the front car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the doors whoosh shut...but Jason PRIES THEM OPEN. The TRAIN ENGINEER glances back from his booth, seeing Jason  making the improper entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey pal, you can't do that... A second later he's gotten a good look at Jason. It's too late for a retraction as JASON SAVAGELY JAMS HIS HEAD  INTO THE TRAIN CONSOLE.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN CONSOLE
dialogues.text: as the Engineer's arm KNOCKS THE THROTTLE FORWARD...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the train begins to move, racing into the black  tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie and Sean run for their lives, arriving at the  end of a car, jamming the separating doors open and  entering the next car. Jason follows right behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the train thunders through the station without  stopping, baffling several waiting COMMUTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --seeing Sean and Rennie disappear through another  connecting door. We storm our way through it into the  next car right after them. A handful of TRAVELERS cower  away from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the train rapidly speeds past us, showing no signs of  slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean and Rennie come through another set of separating doors, rushing through... finding they're in the last  car. They look back, seeing Jason enter at the opposite  end. The monster stalks forward. Sean's eyes dart  around. He spots the EMERGENCY STOP CORD. HE LEAPS FOR  IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the train SCREECHES TO A HALT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sudden stop throws Jason on his back. Sean throws the rear door open, jumping out with Rennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean and Rennie sprint down the center of the tracks  toward the light of the next station, running out of  strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they emerge from the darkness, up to the edge of the  pit. Sean boosts Rennie up, starting to climb up himself  when:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: fires out from the tunnel, grabbing onto Sean's ankle.  Rennie screams as Sean is dragged down...but he manages  to latch onto a chain securing a garbage receptacle.  Jason pulls harder, stretching Sean to his limit as  Rennie watches helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: runs straight towards the track pit like a football  punter, RECOILING WITH HER RIGHT LEG, KICKING JASON  SQUARELY IN THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: JASON, (EFX)
dialogues.text: trips backwards and LANDS ON THE THIRD, ELECTRIFIED RAIL, RECEIVING TEN THOUSAND VOLTS. His body smokes and  convulses, finally sizzling out. He appears to be  terminated!!!

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND RENNIE
dialogues.text: as they get to their feet, holding each other tight,  looking down on the now-dead undead creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as our heroes arise into the neon-filled big city  wonderland, relieved to be alive, gazing around at the  awesome spectacle known as Times Square. A huge DIGITAL  CLOCK tells us it's a quarter to midnight. Sean wraps his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Rennie. It's finally over. Camera RISES ABOVE THEM, RACKING BACK TO THE SUBWAY EXIT. Guess who has just made an encore...with more energy  than ever!!!

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND RENNIE
dialogues.text: look all around them, having never been to a city as big  as this. They finally turn far enough around to spot  JASON in a series of three quick cuts, each one closer  than the last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God...please no... But Jason keeps on coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody help us!! He's going to kill  us!!! But the heavy Times Square foot traffic ignores her,  bustling onward. Rennie and Sean have no choice but to  flee again.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: shoves his way through the preoccupied pedestrians;  they've certainly seen weirder characters than him here.  He moves past a group of STREET URCHINS listening to some rap from their ghetto blaster. His foot obliterates  their stereo system with one stride. They instantly pull  out switchblades and chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dead meat, slime bag. Jason stops, turning around, towering over the kids. He  has blood and gore caked everywhere, his skin charred  from the electrocution. Jason starts to remove his mask,  facing them squarely.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON STREET URCHINS
dialogues.text: as Jason's mask comes off out-of-frame. Their tough faces turn to putty, scared completely shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, it's cool, it's cool... They turn tail and race like the wind. Jason steps  forward so that we're looking at the back of his head,  never seeing his naked face. He slips his hockey mask on  again, turns into a CLOSE UP, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: filled with noise, smoke and derelicts. A tough,  redheaded WAITRESS with a thick Brooklyn accent stands  behind the countertop, a wall of mirrors behind her. The  front door bangs open with the entrance of Sean and  Rennie, rushing up to the waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to call the police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, hurry... A telephone sits right next to her, but this is New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a pay phone in back. They start to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand -- there's a  maniac trying to kill us!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blase)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to New York. There's no time for further response as JASON CRASHES

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE DINER DOOR, MOWING A PATH STRAIGHT TOWARDS
dialogues.text: THEM. Sean and Rennie run out the back as the Waitress  eyes Jason with complete disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the BURLY CHEF comes out to confront him. Jason FLINGS HIM HEAD FIRST INTO THE JUKEBOX.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: picks up the telephone, really pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: A BIKER
dialogues.text: climbs off his counter stool, revealing a HUGE BOWIE  KNIFE. Jason plows straight for him and the Biker STABS  JASON IN THE HEART. Jason has little reaction, pulling it out, tossing it aside. The Biker's face goes wan, backing away.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: stops in mid-dial. Fear is starting to register now.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: lifts the very large man and EFFORTLESSLY HEAVES HIM INTO THE MIRROR OVER THE COUNTER.

dialogues.speaker: THE WAITRESS
dialogues.text: feels the phone receiver slipping from her grasp, her  mouth trembling. She backs away from the beast as far as  she can. Jason has no time to waste on her, trampling out the back after Rennie and Sean as the other patrons  shrink from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean fumbles to unlock three deadbolts and two chains, finally getting the back door open and springing into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run about ten yards before realizing the alley is a  dead end. Sean and Rennie start to head back the other  way when JASON MOWS OUT FROM THE DINER DOOR. Their vision scatters everywhere in search of a retreat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! She's spotted a MANHOLE COVER, slightly ajar. They  haven't the luxury of thinking about it, Sean sliding the cover back as Jason comes forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as they descend into hell...a massive chamber consisting  of tall columns, slimy catacombs and three feet of  stagnant water. Their alternatives are nil; Sean and  Rennie join hands, wading through the swill, splashing  deeper into the labyrinth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the dim streetlight glowing in the above world is  eclipsed by JASON, making his way down after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An oval tunnel slanted downward into pitch blackness.  Dim overhead lights illuminate salt deposits and eery  rust formations. Rennie and Sean appear at the far end,  wading from the sewage as the tunnel rises toward us.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT
dialogues.text: as they come forward at a brisk but cautious pace,  strangers in a very strange land.

dialogues.speaker: THEIR FEET
dialogues.text: sloshing through the slime. All is silent until Sean's  foot TRIPS OVER A BARREL labeled HUGHES CHEMICAL PLANT.  A vaporous green substance oozes out the rusty end of  the container, sizzling on the around.

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND RENNIE
dialogues.text: carefully sidestep it, continuing on. They make it  another ten yards when A FIGURE LEAPS OUT FROM AN ALCOVE, GRIPPING A HUGE WRENCH. Rennie's scream echoes through  the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but it's a middle-aged SANITATION ENGINEER who lowers  the wrench, as frightened as they are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you kids doing down  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help us get out??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure can and we don't have a minute  to waste. He begins quickly packing up his tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toxic waste, son. This sewer floods  out with the stuff on the 13th of  every month, right at midnight. (checks watch)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's less than ten minutes from  now. Rennie looks down the dark tunnels in all directions,  swallowing hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow me. He clicks on his high powered flashlight and quickly  leads them down:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no less threatening than the one they just left. When  they pass a lightless intersecting corridor, JASON EJECTS

dialogues.speaker: THE FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: rolls through the muck, its beam splashing erratically  across the polluted walls.

dialogues.speaker: THE SANITATION ENGINEER
dialogues.text: begins BASHING JASON'S HEAD IN WITH HIS WRENCH but the  monster drags the kicking and screaming man into TUNNEL  #3.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: tries to help up Sean but he's been knocked into the  opposite wall, barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Rennie... She's struck with indecisive shock, looking into Tunnel  #3, seeing:

dialogues.speaker: A GRUESOME SHADOW ON THE WALL
dialogues.text: Jason arches his back with wrench in hand, hammering it  over and over into the Sanitation Engineer's skull.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: backs away but does not run. The time has come to face  her fears.

dialogues.speaker: SHADOW ON TUNNEL
dialogues.text: as Jason takes one more vengeful stroke, finishing him  off. He steps from Tunnel #3 with the scarlet-coated  tool, his shadow becoming flesh. He moves straight for  Sean, who has no hope for escape. Jason cocks the wrench  over Sean's skull...and suddenly his hockey mask is  SPLASHED WITH A BRIGHT LIGHT. Jason stops, turning  directly into it.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: Rennie is blinding us with the sanitation Engineer's  flashlight, giving us only brief glimpses of herself in  the reflective wet surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never got me in the lake, Jason.  And you're not going to get me now  either. Her voice is defiant. She carefully backstops, the  irritating light never leaving us.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: has been sufficiently taunted. He moves after her.

dialogues.speaker: JASON'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: as the bright beam leaves our eyes, Rennie dashing down  the intersecting tunnel (#1).

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON JASON'S FEET
dialogues.text: stomping through the sludge, picking up speed. He's  wanted to kill Rennie most of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie dashes up to the HUGHES CHEMICAL DRUM Sean  tripped over, using the back end of the flashlight to  crush in the can's rusted lid. The metal is flimsy but  still resists her blows. She frantically hammers harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's moving like a freight train now, an addict rolling  after his fix.

dialogues.speaker: CHEMICAL DRUM
dialogues.text: as the butt of the flashlight dents the metal, ultimately causing it to cave in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Looking through his unblinking eyes, whipping into  Tunnel #1...where we catch a fleeting glimpse of Rennie  flinging the contents of the oil drum. A half second  later a WAVE OF GRAY/GREEN LIQUID FLIES AT US...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON JASON, (SLOW MOTION)
dialogues.text: and his hockey mask is SPLASHED WITH TOXIC WASTE,  SEEPING INTO HIS MASK'S EYE SLITS. He careens back as if  her were a rabid dog receiving a load of point-blank  buckshot.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: drops the can, fumbling for the flashlight again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the radiant flashlight beam finds his mask, the  plastic beginning to bubble and melt. RUSH INTO A TIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIDEOUS FACE: rotted flesh, some of it sizzling from the  chemical. Worms slithering out his nostrils. And his  eyes...or lack thereof. They're like two raw quail eggs  frying in liquid green pollutant...and the yolks just  broke, running down his face.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHLIGHT
dialogues.text: as the beam begins to waver in her quivering grasp. RISE  TO FIND RENNIE'S FACE, reacting to the stomach-turning  sight of Jason's visage. She grabs hold of her senses and RUNS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie skirts past the blinded creature: WHIP PAN WITH HER as she turns down Tunnel #2, heading back toward  Sean. CONTINUE TO QUICKLY PAN AROUND until we've come  around 360 degrees and are back on JASON, in no way  ready to give up. He staggers after Rennie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Rennie skids up to Sean, still dazed. She grabs him,  shaking hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get up, Sean!!! His eyes blink, only half coherent. Then an inconceivable terror registers in her ears...A LOW, DEEP RUMBLING  SOUND, COMING FROM UP AHEAD. Her head jerks in the  direction of her planned retreat:

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: An ominously empty tunnel, soon to be filled with the  unthinkable. The sound of RUSHING LIQUID is growing at  leaps and bounds.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON RENNIE
dialogues.text: as her trembling chin rises, looking at:

dialogues.speaker: TUNNEL
dialogues.text: The dim overhead lights are beginning to vibrate from  the approaching flood.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: rotates her head and sees:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: vision or no vision, he is lurching towards her  relentlessly. She is literally sandwiched between hell  and high water.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: drags Sean to his feet with the strength of a possessed  woman, pulling him over to a SERVICE LADDER attached to  the intersecting alcove wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb!!! She shoves him up it from below, Sean summoning  everything he's got to obey her. Rennie shoots a stare  back down the tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (EFX)
dialogues.text: The overhead lights are banging around like an earthquake has just hit; the liquid will be arriving any second. Her vision WHIP PANS 180 DEGREES TO FIND JASON APPROACHING  FROM THE OPPOSITE END, groping around with his scaly arms like the claws of a roto-tiller.

dialogues.speaker: LADDER
dialogues.text: as Rennie starts up after Sean, looking down and seeing:

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: within ten feet of them, shifting directly for the ladder like he's working on some kind of radar.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE
dialogues.text: slips on the rusty ladder, regaining her footing. and  rushing higher. She takes her final glance into the  tunnel, the ultimate horror registering in her corneas as she sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A million gallons of green-brown toxic waste splash into  the far intersection, FILLING THE TUNNEL, FLOODING  STRAIGHT FOR CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: has just started to climb the ladder when the wind and  smell of the rushing toxic waste bombards him. His  decomposed head swivels to face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tons of lethal sewage, stopping for no one. Arriving in  seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't need vision to confirm what his other senses  already know. Jason's mouth begins to quaver...AND THE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmmmmmommy...DON'T LET ME DROWN,  MOMMY... Camera speeds toward his gaping mouth and DOWN HIS THROAT as lightning arcs off his mucous covered insides. We  sink deeper into his guts, fire and smoke flaring into  our eves, eventually coming to a WELL IN THE PIT OF HIS  STOMACH, FILLED WITH BLOOD...and EIGHT YEAR OLD JASON IS  DROWNING IN IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hhhhelp me.... A split second later:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wall of deadly toxic liquid ENGULFS JASON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powerful flood thrashes the ladder about two inches  below Rennie's feet, the force of it fiercely shaking  their rusty support. They are clinging to the ladder with their eyes squeezed shut. Praying for survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are drowning in a chunky cloud of sewage, rushing over and under us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The digital clock we saw earlier abruptly CHIMES

dialogues.speaker: SEAN AND RENNIE, (EFX)
dialogues.text: as the sewage level begins to drop. Rennie opens her  eyes, glancing straight down and seeing.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE'S POINT OF VIEW, (EFX)
dialogues.text: The ladder beneath them reappears...which gives way to a  PAIR OF HANDS GRIPPING THE BOTTOM RUNG. The liquid drops  further, unshrouding the now-dead corpse of EIGHT YEAR  OLD JASON. He's a relatively normal looking boy,  probably the way he looked back in 1957...right when he  drowned in Crystal Lake. Jason Voorhees has finally been put to rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rennie and Sean stagger out from a side street, holding  each other up...relief etched in their matured faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear there's a statue here that's 22  stories tall. Rennie would smile if she could. She kisses his cheek.  They amble on.

dialogues.speaker: STALKING POINT OF VIEW
dialogues.text: ...coming out from another alley, creeping up behind them through a crowd of pedestrians. About the height of a  small child.

dialogues.speaker: RENNIE AND SEAN
dialogues.text: walk arm in arm, exhausted and oblivious to their  pursuer. But something, some innate perception causes  Rennie to slow...and stop. Her eyes register a horrid  fear and she WHIPS AROUND TO FACE...

dialogues.speaker: TOBY
dialogues.text: Limping on all fours, filthy with grease-matted fur. The  whimpering dog crawls up to her, Rennie bending down,  hugging her animal like she'll never let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Toby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Sean bends down too, ruffling the dog's fur, standing  again with Rennie. The three survivors enter the collage  of pedestrians, bright lights and skyscrapers.  It is finally over.
